subject: Unpin beaker-rspec
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-19 14:30:52.000000000', 'files': ['spec/acceptance/nodesets/nodepool-trusty.yml', 'Gemfile', 'spec/acceptance/nodesets/nodepool-centos7.yml'], 'message': "Unpin beaker-rspec

The latest version of beaker tries to manage sshd_config[1] in order to
pass through environment variables. JJB also tries to manage
sshd_config by adding Match blocks to securely allow root SSH[2]. When
beaker tries to append the PermitUserEnvironment line after the Match
blocks, SSH fails to open port 22 and beaker can't SSH in to the
node[3]. This patch unpins beaker-rspec and adds set_env: false to the
nodepool nodesets so that the set_env method is never called and does
not try to mess with the sshd_config.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L528
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml#n42
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/61/185161/1/check/gate-puppet-nova-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-centos7/cd81608/console.html.gz#_2015-05-22_22_05_46_933
[4] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L502

Change-Id: I69f7cfe293fa26a8bd43aef2af898db262872bc7
"}]
commit_message:
Unpin beaker-rspec

The latest version of beaker tries to manage sshd_config[1] in order to
pass through environment variables. JJB also tries to manage
sshd_config by adding Match blocks to securely allow root SSH[2]. When
beaker tries to append the PermitUserEnvironment line after the Match
blocks, SSH fails to open port 22 and beaker can't SSH in to the
node[3]. This patch unpins beaker-rspec and adds set_env: false to the
nodepool nodesets so that the set_env method is never called and does
not try to mess with the sshd_config.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L528
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml#n42
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/61/185161/1/check/gate-puppet-nova-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-centos7/cd81608/console.html.gz#_2015-05-22_22_05_46_933
[4] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L502

Change-Id: I69f7cfe293fa26a8bd43aef2af898db262872bc7

commit_message:
Remove ordereddict from requirements

Ordereddict was required for py26 support. Since we have
dropped support for py26 (we are no longer gating on it) we
should remove it as a requirement and remove references
to it in the code.

Change-Id: I648edbb5d0b51c003f08f5f5c4ce700128032b38
Partial-bug: 1445827
(cherry picked from commit 20ec82f18c368bbc8a89e79d2d6eee2de2c2a9ea)

commit_message:
Fix setup.cfg.

setup.cfg wasn't specifying the packages that we use (and had a no
longer needed bit of glue code). Without this, the installed
requirements are not usable as the library is missing.

Change-Id: I4a2bc2bfcccab00c248d42c45b4c6ec184ea740f

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-11-14 13:41:06.000000000', 'files': ['glance/registry/client/v1/client.py', 'glance/api/common.py'], 'message': "Extract redundant usage of save_and_reraise_exception

In some cases the exception context can be cleared,
resulting in None being attempted to be re-raised after
an exception handler is run. I think that previously
save_and_reraise_exception was used in places where we can't
get an inner exception.

Change-Id: I6ebca93239b489e889ccc40669a5112ede224c6c
Closes-bug: 1281453
"}]
commit_message:
Extract redundant usage of save_and_reraise_exception

In some cases the exception context can be cleared,
resulting in None being attempted to be re-raised after
an exception handler is run. I think that previously
save_and_reraise_exception was used in places where we can't
get an inner exception.

Change-Id: I6ebca93239b489e889ccc40669a5112ede224c6c
Closes-bug: 1281453

commit_message:
Allows usage of reduced redundancy storage

This patch allows the use of S3's reduced redundancy storage
when using the S3 store.

It also eliminates an implicit boolean casting issue in the
glance.store.s3.Store._options_get function.

Change-Id: Idb6280f90ee762dad79fe109ccf3c141b6b55958
Closes-Bug: 1222963

It has been included instructions that make sqlite file as default
option for synchronizing tables and columns.  It has been also
added the exclusion of db files from the scope of git.

subject: Add option to push service image to Glance
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-09 18:27:04.000000000', 'files': ['spec/defines/manila_service_instance_spec.rb', 'manifests/service_instance.pp'], 'message': 'Add option to push service image to Glance

The default behavior was previously to take the URL that was in
service_image_location, download it, and load that into Glance. There
are instances where this is not desired behavior, so adding a new
boolean service_image_push_to_glance. If false, it skips the Glance
loading portion, but still writes the relevant manila.conf values.

Change-Id: Ic388553f0a5779506c39a1d4cdc3894992b98afe
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to push service image to Glance

The default behavior was previously to take the URL that was in
service_image_location, download it, and load that into Glance. There
are instances where this is not desired behavior, so adding a new
boolean service_image_push_to_glance. If false, it skips the Glance
loading portion, but still writes the relevant manila.conf values.

Change-Id: Ic388553f0a5779506c39a1d4cdc3894992b98afe

subject: refresh the devstack plugin docs, add plugin registry
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-19 12:48:39.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/plugins.rst', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/plugin-registry.rst'], 'message': "refresh the devstack plugin docs, add plugin registry

The devstack plugin docs mostly referred to in tree plugins, which is
honestly something we don't want people doing. Instead restructure the
whole document to talk about external plugins as the only kinds of
plugins, and focus on a workflow to make that easy for people to work
through.

This also adds a plugin-registry page to start listing known plugins
somewhere centrally. Some sample content was added, hopefully people
will submit patches to include their plugins.

This does drop the section on hypervisor plugins. That's not currently
something that we expect a ton of people to work on, so diving into
the code for this should be fine.

Change-Id: Ifc0b831c90a1a45daa507a009d1dcffcd6e2deca
"}]
commit_message:
refresh the devstack plugin docs, add plugin registry

The devstack plugin docs mostly referred to in tree plugins, which is
honestly something we don't want people doing. Instead restructure the
whole document to talk about external plugins as the only kinds of
plugins, and focus on a workflow to make that easy for people to work
through.

This also adds a plugin-registry page to start listing known plugins
somewhere centrally. Some sample content was added, hopefully people
will submit patches to include their plugins.

This does drop the section on hypervisor plugins. That's not currently
something that we expect a ton of people to work on, so diving into
the code for this should be fine.

Change-Id: Ifc0b831c90a1a45daa507a009d1dcffcd6e2deca

subject: Add Neutron/Nova Floating IP list/search/get
revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2015-06-19 16:24:35.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_neutron.py', 'shade/_utils.py', 'shade/tests/fakes.py', 'shade/__init__.py', 'shade/_tasks.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_nova.py'], 'message': 'Add Neutron/Nova Floating IP list/search/get

Some clouds out there are still running nova-network but we want to
provide support for neutron specific features and concepts like ports,
networks, subnets, etc.

This change is part of a set that adds neutron support to existing
floating IP-related functions, hiding that behind resource-oriented
methods.
For instance, at high level, end-users can now request that a public IP
is assigned to an instance without worrying about the specific service,
procedures and protocols used to provide that feature.

Change-Id: I35c3af4b8c43af9988463785cb48c0c41abe6abe
'}]
commit_message:
Add Neutron/Nova Floating IP list/search/get

Some clouds out there are still running nova-network but we want to
provide support for neutron specific features and concepts like ports,
networks, subnets, etc.

This change is part of a set that adds neutron support to existing
floating IP-related functions, hiding that behind resource-oriented
methods.
For instance, at high level, end-users can now request that a public IP
is assigned to an instance without worrying about the specific service,
procedures and protocols used to provide that feature.

Change-Id: I35c3af4b8c43af9988463785cb48c0c41abe6abe

commit_message:
don't run dsvm tests on doc only changes

If the change is only docs, don't run the dsvm changes. This will save
a lot of test resources, and make doc patches much easier for everyone
to land and faster to iterate on.

Change-Id: Id0f498089dddab4cbf4b76b97ef87546544fba99

Change-Id: Idc772651065d0ec76b28b7214408562d4d001235
'}]
commit_message:
Adding angular dashboard plugin mechanism

We have a way to dynamically inject modules at the horizon.app level, but
not a way to dynamically inject modules at the hz.dashboard level. This
patch will allow that. This way, users can pick and choose which dashboard
they want enabled without modifying source.

Change-Id: Idc772651065d0ec76b28b7214408562d4d001235

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-19 10:05:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': 'DHCP agent: Set an "ipxe" tag to work with Ironic

Ironic expects neutron to have an "ipxe" tag for the option 175 which is
sent by iPXE/gPXE when booting a node. The problem is that up to now this
tag was not created by Neutron, causing the nodes deployed with Ironic
+ iPXE to fail to boot. This patch is creating this tag when launching
the dnsmasq process.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I45a0f51365b37e7d85848fcdcbcf7aa6a1dddfed
Closes-Bug: #1442123
'}]
commit_message:
DHCP agent: Set an "ipxe" tag to work with Ironic

Ironic expects neutron to have an "ipxe" tag for the option 175 which is
sent by iPXE/gPXE when booting a node. The problem is that up to now this
tag was not created by Neutron, causing the nodes deployed with Ironic
+ iPXE to fail to boot. This patch is creating this tag when launching
the dnsmasq process.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I45a0f51365b37e7d85848fcdcbcf7aa6a1dddfed
Closes-Bug: #1442123

subject: fields: report what the wrong type was when coerce fails
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-18 16:02:06.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py'], 'message': 'fields: report what the wrong type was when coerce fails

The coerce method impls all raise an exception when the
python type provided for a field does not match what was
required. Sometimes it is pretty hard to figure out what
the wrong type was, so report this along with the desired
type

This changes the exception message from something like

 "A datetime.datetime is required in field start"

to

 "A datetime.datetime is required in field start, not a str"

which can help debugging.

Change-Id: I53535e7af2165285ef1804f03f0beebe8fc42a59
'}]
commit_message:
fields: report what the wrong type was when coerce fails

The coerce method impls all raise an exception when the
python type provided for a field does not match what was
required. Sometimes it is pretty hard to figure out what
the wrong type was, so report this along with the desired
type

This changes the exception message from something like

 "A datetime.datetime is required in field start"

to

 "A datetime.datetime is required in field start, not a str"

which can help debugging.

Change-Id: I53535e7af2165285ef1804f03f0beebe8fc42a59

subject: Fix unit tests from initial import
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-19 17:20:30.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/tests/unit/test_glance_image_plugin.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/glance/__init__.py', 'searchlight/locale/searchlight.pot'], 'message': "Fix unit tests from initial import

Two problems are preventing glance's unit tests passing -
  * 'members' was conditional on image visibility; for consistency
    I've changed serialization so 'members' is always present even
    if empty
  * is_public isn't a field glanceclient.v2 returns and was inconsistent
    in the one place it was specified in the test file

Also adds initial .pot file which is required by pep8 tests.

Change-Id: I6bddae7f2891f6089bf821fb8b14686020745a51
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unit tests from initial import

Two problems are preventing glance's unit tests passing -
  * 'members' was conditional on image visibility; for consistency
    I've changed serialization so 'members' is always present even
    if empty
  * is_public isn't a field glanceclient.v2 returns and was inconsistent
    in the one place it was specified in the test file

Also adds initial .pot file which is required by pep8 tests.

Change-Id: I6bddae7f2891f6089bf821fb8b14686020745a51

We made previous attempt to get rid of all warnings, but it turned out
that gate does not execute tox's docs job but runs build_sphinx
directly.

The latter behaviour should be fixed, but while at it, we
should prepare neutron job to be executed in gate by cleaning up all
warnings.

Closes-Bug: #1466554

Change-Id: I8c265eae2175425568479116d1faef7d87fdcc02
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed the only sphinx warning in docs

We made previous attempt to get rid of all warnings, but it turned out
that gate does not execute tox's docs job but runs build_sphinx
directly.

The latter behaviour should be fixed, but while at it, we
should prepare neutron job to be executed in gate by cleaning up all
warnings.

Closes-Bug: #1466554

Change-Id: I8c265eae2175425568479116d1faef7d87fdcc02

This commit is a preparation step for using pluggable IPAM.
1. Moved get_subnets functionality to db_base_plugin_common to make it
accessible by ipam backends.
2. Reworked update_subnet routine:
- moved db part into update_db_subnet;

'}]
commit_message:
Decompose db_base_plugin_v2.py with changes

This commit is a preparation step for using pluggable IPAM.
1. Moved get_subnets functionality to db_base_plugin_common to make it
accessible by ipam backends.
2. Reworked update_subnet routine:
- moved db part into update_db_subnet;

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-ipam

Change-Id: Idb8f54d9fccaad1137222d156590c37d86aa576b

subject: Add a script to safely update feature branches
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-12 22:21:34.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst', 'update_feature_branch.sh'], 'message': 'Add a script to safely update feature branches

This automates the process that used to be described on the wiki for
updating feature branches:

  https://wiki.openstack.org/w/index.php?title=Obsolete:GerritJenkinsGit&oldid=73783#Merge_Commits

This content appears to have been removed from the wiki and lost in the
transition to <http://docs.openstack.org/>.

In addition to the process outlined on the old wiki page, this includes
some extra automation to ensure consistent results -- and to ensure that
gerrit is not flooded with hundreds of new reviews at once by mistake.

Change-Id: I24976e99fa21bd1d724e0619b4927098b702c840
'}]
commit_message:
Add a script to safely update feature branches

This automates the process that used to be described on the wiki for
updating feature branches:

  https://wiki.openstack.org/w/index.php?title=Obsolete:GerritJenkinsGit&oldid=73783#Merge_Commits

This content appears to have been removed from the wiki and lost in the
transition to <http://docs.openstack.org/>.

In addition to the process outlined on the old wiki page, this includes
some extra automation to ensure consistent results -- and to ensure that
gerrit is not flooded with hundreds of new reviews at once by mistake.

Change-Id: I24976e99fa21bd1d724e0619b4927098b702c840

TOSCA spec has dropped db_ and dbms_ prefix from the properties name of
Database and DBMS node respectively, as it's implied.

subject: Use environment requirement markers
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-01 23:33:14.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Use environment requirement markers

Certain requirements do not need to exist on py3.x or py2.7
where they have been built-in and/or included into the
standard library so denote these requirements using the
new requirement markers capability of pbr (and python).

Fixes bug 1445827

Change-Id: Iff37e4eca8bf176c67797420f17605f9de3e8afc
'}]
commit_message:
Use environment requirement markers

Certain requirements do not need to exist on py3.x or py2.7
where they have been built-in and/or included into the
standard library so denote these requirements using the
new requirement markers capability of pbr (and python).

Fixes bug 1445827

Change-Id: Iff37e4eca8bf176c67797420f17605f9de3e8afc

subject: Allow FixedIntervalLoopingCall continue after exceptions in callee
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-16 19:35:21.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/loopingcall.py', 'tests/unit/test_loopingcall.py'], 'message': "Allow FixedIntervalLoopingCall continue after exceptions in callee

In some cases we don't want Looping call to iterrupt if there is
an uncaught exception in the callee. In case of exception LoopingCall
needs to wait similarly as if a call succeeded.

Change-Id: Ifbebcf53f4c20ab0339fbe6797518810f59bee38
"}]
commit_message:
Allow FixedIntervalLoopingCall continue after exceptions in callee

In some cases we don't want Looping call to iterrupt if there is
an uncaught exception in the callee. In case of exception LoopingCall
needs to wait similarly as if a call succeeded.

Change-Id: Ifbebcf53f4c20ab0339fbe6797518810f59bee38

commit_message:
Take configuraiton control to test hooks for networking-odl

This will enable us to reduce the dependency on Tempest, just
as much as the other Neutron/-* jobs do, and long term allow
us to drive testing efforts directly from networking-odl
patches.

Change-Id: I8be805958df399f29f5cd24bdb59179d41f7e447
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 1736, 'name': 'Ivan Kolodyazhny', 'email': 'e0ne@e0ne.info', 'username': 'e0ne'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 10795, 'name': 'Rajesh Tailor', 'email': 'tailor.rajesh88@gmail.com', 'username': 'rajeshtailor'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-03-21 03:16:16.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'openstack/common/service.py'], 'message': "Recommend users of service.py use `launch_service_class`

Instead of having a complete/fulfilled service object be
what is launched, instead recommend that a service class
is passed in that will become a 'actual' service after fork.

This will avoid the issues with the complete/fulfilled
service object opening sockets, or performing other actions
in its constructor (which causes later issues with sockets
and open file descriptors) by delaying that constructor call
until after forking.

Change-Id: I54feece31d40e8e03661633cf5ec3080cd9999e2
"}]
commit_message:
Recommend users of service.py use `launch_service_class`

Instead of having a complete/fulfilled service object be
what is launched, instead recommend that a service class
is passed in that will become a 'actual' service after fork.

This will avoid the issues with the complete/fulfilled
service object opening sockets, or performing other actions
in its constructor (which causes later issues with sockets
and open file descriptors) by delaying that constructor call
until after forking.

Change-Id: I54feece31d40e8e03661633cf5ec3080cd9999e2

stable/juno branch of Manila is not compatible with latest Manilaclient,

commit_message:
[stable/juno] Nail Manila branch and Manilaclient tag in Devstack

stable/juno branch of Manila is not compatible with latest Manilaclient,
so set compatible tag "1.0.1" for Manilaclient in Devstack and "stable/juno"
branch for Manila itself, which will be useful for local deployments by users.

Change-Id: I3e2092e3fa37d52d1b96de501efc711ab8a24827

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2015-06-19 15:59:20.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v2/volume_encryption_types.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v2/fakes.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v2/test_volume_encryption_types.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': 'Add encryption-type-update to cinderclient

This modification adds support for updating volume encryption types. The
encryption-type-update command requires a single argument, the name or
ID of the volume type whose associated encryption type should be
updated, and up to four optional arguments representing new values for
the encryption type attributes. The update implementation supports three
use cases:

1. The user wants to specify new values for attributes of an
   encryption type.
   - include the attribute and its new value at invocation
2. The user wants to preserve the values for attributes of an
   encryption type.
   - exclude the attribute at invocation
3. The user wants to set the values for attributes of an encryption
   type to provider defaults (only valid for cipher and key-size).
   - include the attribute but provide no value at invocation

The encryption type may only be updated if the associated volume type is
unused.

This modification leverages update support for encryption types provided
by the cinder volume encryption type API extension. See the following
patch for more information:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58344/

blueprint: encrypt-cinder-volumes
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/encrypt-cinder-volumes

Change-Id: I8e6a37428e76ba69a422468630fdb66b4fe460ab
DocImpact'}]
commit_message:
Add encryption-type-update to cinderclient

This modification adds support for updating volume encryption types. The
encryption-type-update command requires a single argument, the name or
ID of the volume type whose associated encryption type should be
updated, and up to four optional arguments representing new values for
the encryption type attributes. The update implementation supports three
use cases:

1. The user wants to specify new values for attributes of an
   encryption type.
   - include the attribute and its new value at invocation
2. The user wants to preserve the values for attributes of an
   encryption type.
   - exclude the attribute at invocation
3. The user wants to set the values for attributes of an encryption
   type to provider defaults (only valid for cipher and key-size).
   - include the attribute but provide no value at invocation

The encryption type may only be updated if the associated volume type is
unused.

This modification leverages update support for encryption types provided
by the cinder volume encryption type API extension. See the following
patch for more information:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58344/

blueprint: encrypt-cinder-volumes
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/encrypt-cinder-volumes

Change-Id: I8e6a37428e76ba69a422468630fdb66b4fe460ab
DocImpact

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-04-15 14:29:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'nova/utils.py'], 'message': "Store context in local store after spawn_n

After a utils.spawn_n call we lose the context for logging because it's
not in the local thread store.  This was causing log lines to miss
context.  Additionally a call to context.get_admin_context() would add
that context to the local store making it appear that the context had
changed during a request.

This wraps methods being called with spawn_n so that they add the
context to the local store immediately.

Closes-Bug: 1404268

Change-Id: Ia5175c9729069df3d779237ba6039cf5bc920018
"}]
commit_message:
Store context in local store after spawn_n

After a utils.spawn_n call we lose the context for logging because it's
not in the local thread store.  This was causing log lines to miss
context.  Additionally a call to context.get_admin_context() would add
that context to the local store making it appear that the context had
changed during a request.

This wraps methods being called with spawn_n so that they add the
context to the local store immediately.

Closes-Bug: 1404268

Change-Id: Ia5175c9729069df3d779237ba6039cf5bc920018

commit_message:
Create an OSC plugin for heat-translator

Creating the framework for an OSC plugin for heat-translator.
This will make adding new commands easier, incorporates them into
OSC, and provides the capabilities of authentication should
it be required in the future (using heatclient after translating
a template).

partially implements bp openstack-client-heat-translator

Change-Id: Ie477eac9acd9ed26f00069947af0d25b3c7e67b1

commit_message:
Fix functional test gate

I think a change in the gate has triggered a different behavior
and now we can not create a server without a network.

Also, I've added a wait for delete method to wait for the vms to
be deleted so the network delete works properly.

Change-Id: I2ec28f62de10147ab8d65e0ad15d94854f6e3aeb

Change-Id: I24f8b4daf099af8bb03c3a4f6417b6c87bd49021
Closes-Bug: #1466632
'}]
commit_message:
Use host_device mode for qemu-img

When writing to a host device, possibly one that does not support holes,
it is preferable to use host_device instead of the raw mode. Not doing so
means holes are simply skipped and the deployed image is invalid.

Change-Id: I24f8b4daf099af8bb03c3a4f6417b6c87bd49021
Closes-Bug: #1466632

subject: Support variations of external network attribute
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-19 15:20:01.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/network/v2/test_network.py', 'openstack/network/v2/network.py'], 'message': "Support variations of external network attribute

When I went to find an available internal network, I realized
there was a difference in the network resource.  The documentation
indicates the attribute is resource:external, but my devstack and
the gate are using resource_type = 'Internal' or 'External'.  I've
added a method that should handle both cases.

Change-Id: I72c889a2314ddafda1a4134a51b85aa05e198a7d
Closes-Bug: #1465813
"}]
commit_message:
Support variations of external network attribute

When I went to find an available internal network, I realized
there was a difference in the network resource.  The documentation
indicates the attribute is resource:external, but my devstack and
the gate are using resource_type = 'Internal' or 'External'.  I've
added a method that should handle both cases.

Change-Id: I72c889a2314ddafda1a4134a51b85aa05e198a7d
Closes-Bug: #1465813

subject: Centralize exception management for Neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-18 22:43:45.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_shade.py', 'shade/__init__.py', 'shade/exc.py'], 'message': 'Centralize exception management for Neutron

A common pattern we use is to catch OpenStack clients exceptions and
re-raise an OpenStackCloud* exceptions.
Moreover, we need to distinguish NeutronClientException with status
code 404 from other Neutron exceptions in order to handle Rax broken
catalog (i.e. falling-through and using Nova API).

This patch centralises all that.

Change-Id: Ia14083bee7988e90a9e5ce04305a8ead4511b3d3
'}]
commit_message:
Centralize exception management for Neutron

A common pattern we use is to catch OpenStack clients exceptions and
re-raise an OpenStackCloud* exceptions.
Moreover, we need to distinguish NeutronClientException with status
code 404 from other Neutron exceptions in order to handle Rax broken
catalog (i.e. falling-through and using Nova API).

This patch centralises all that.

Change-Id: Ia14083bee7988e90a9e5ce04305a8ead4511b3d3

commit_message:
Pin keystonemiddleware max version

To resolve requirements conflicts in most painless way before 6.1 GA
let's ping keystonemiddleware to max version 2.0.0 and in 7.0 we
can remove upper bounds as well update packages in our mirros.

Change-Id: I98055060480a2ef80b9d56a211812e98e27fa2e1
Closes-Bug: #1466733

'docker/centos/binary/heat/heat-api-cfn/start.sh'], 'message': 'Symlink all non Dockerfile resources in images

The only files in the docker image directories that differ majorly between
distros are the Dockerfiles (e.g. different package manager mechanisms,
different repo sources, etc).

The supporting files such as the start.sh/check.sh and config files should
largely stay the same between base images.

This change moves these files up into a "common" directory, and symlinks them
in the same way that the build script is managed. This means when adding a new
base distro only new Dockerfiles need to be created. Also, if a distro does
happen to require a vastly different start.sh script for example, one can
choose to simply not symlink to the common and instead drop in a custom one.

Implements: blueprint refactor-base-image-layout

Change-Id: Ic4db69d31ff54a1fb95af4853a2e5ae490064284

commit_message:
Symlink all non Dockerfile resources in images

The only files in the docker image directories that differ majorly between
distros are the Dockerfiles (e.g. different package manager mechanisms,
different repo sources, etc).

The supporting files such as the start.sh/check.sh and config files should
largely stay the same between base images.

This change moves these files up into a "common" directory, and symlinks them
in the same way that the build script is managed. This means when adding a new
base distro only new Dockerfiles need to be created. Also, if a distro does
happen to require a vastly different start.sh script for example, one can
choose to simply not symlink to the common and instead drop in a custom one.

Implements: blueprint refactor-base-image-layout

Change-Id: Ic4db69d31ff54a1fb95af4853a2e5ae490064284

commit_message:
[Heat] Add rally template with Heat Resource Group

The patch adds a rally template for
Heat.create_and_delete_stack scenario that allows
to test performance of creation and deletion of Heat
Resource Groups.
The template allows to create a stack that contain
N instances and N volumes attached, where N - is
num_instances parameter in rally template.

Change-Id: If5c7c787c670b464eb3386635bcb1bfc5a218075

commit_message:
Neutron l3, dhcp, ovs, metadata agents now are independed.

Removing co-location between agents prevent us from unrequired
start/stop operations for agents.

Since Juno agents dependency no more need, end even harmful.

Change-Id: I35358dae14ae73e720b705c2d7a46825a1be8fca
Closes-bug: #1459528

subject: Generate consistent length passwords in AIO
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-16 22:25:41.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh'], 'message': "Generate consistent length passwords in AIO

The bootstrap-aio.sh script generates a password by reading a set number
of characters from urandom then removing those that aren't alphanumeric.
The problem with this is that its possible for 0 characters to remain.

This patch changes the order so that tr (translate) reads urandom
directly and removes non alphanumeric characters then that output is
truncated to the required length. This ensures the generated password is
always the desired length.

Change-Id: I03984ab891f88fe4b064f7f7fcb71edf48096493
Closes-Bug: #1465684
"}]
commit_message:
Generate consistent length passwords in AIO

The bootstrap-aio.sh script generates a password by reading a set number
of characters from urandom then removing those that aren't alphanumeric.
The problem with this is that its possible for 0 characters to remain.

This patch changes the order so that tr (translate) reads urandom
directly and removes non alphanumeric characters then that output is
truncated to the required length. This ensures the generated password is
always the desired length.

Change-Id: I03984ab891f88fe4b064f7f7fcb71edf48096493
Closes-Bug: #1465684

will result in failure of volume attachement by Nova.

Closes-Bug: 1430961

subject: Cleanup session creation
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-18 02:06:15.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/common/http.py', 'ironicclient/shell.py', 'ironicclient/tests/unit/test_http.py'], 'message': 'Cleanup session creation

When using the session object we want to pass through unknown kwargs to
the adapter so that keystoneclient can add new parameters as required.

This requires fixing the old options so that we can restrict what is
passed and showing a warning when there are values that are being
ignored.

Change-Id: Ia795dfc8e16c60a08df1636816daefe2ebbd0b03
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup session creation

When using the session object we want to pass through unknown kwargs to
the adapter so that keystoneclient can add new parameters as required.

This requires fixing the old options so that we can restrict what is
passed and showing a warning when there are values that are being
ignored.

Change-Id: Ia795dfc8e16c60a08df1636816daefe2ebbd0b03

commit_message:
Introduce Guru Meditation Reports into Cinder

This commit integrates functionality from the
`openstack.common.report` module into Cinder.
This enables Cinder services to receive SIGUSR1
and print a Guru Meditation Report to stderr.
The required modules were added to
'openstack-common.conf' as well.

It is essentially a copy from implementation of
nova side.

Change-Id: I5bbdc0f97db9b0ebd7b48e50ab7869e2ca33aead
Implements: blueprint guru-meditation-report

commit_message:
Update of `support-modify-volume-image-metadata.rst`

Since snapshot is immutable, we shouldn't provide the capability
to update image metadata referenced with snapshot.
And part of this Spec is not well formatted, we should update it
to make it easier to read after the rst file is coverted into html
file, overall changes is listed below.

- Remove snapshot relevant changes in the SPEC.
- Fix the incorrect format which will cause the html version
  hard to read.
- Update the work items to reflect the latest changes.

Change-Id: I935ae67bca17c2eaa673d87403c0cfa8068f0922

subject: Permits created guests to reach external networks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-12 14:36:49.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron-legacy'], 'message': 'Permits created guests to reach external networks

Adds MASQUERADE target on FLAT_INTERFACE in order to permit the
created guests to reach external networks.   This patch is needed
in order to avoid manual operations when testing guests connectivity.
In your local.conf file, add ALLOW_EGRESS=True in order to enable it.

Change-Id: If60d76497b19da3d936a599e142720ddcee8284b
Closes-bug: #1461228
'}]
commit_message:
Permits created guests to reach external networks

Adds MASQUERADE target on FLAT_INTERFACE in order to permit the
created guests to reach external networks.   This patch is needed
in order to avoid manual operations when testing guests connectivity.
In your local.conf file, add ALLOW_EGRESS=True in order to enable it.

Change-Id: If60d76497b19da3d936a599e142720ddcee8284b
Closes-bug: #1461228

we have <security-group-list> in server create option,
while <security-group-name> in the explanation, they

commit_message:
fix DHCP port changed when dhcp-agent restart

When DHCP server is started, the periodic task is running
before loading cache state.The method port_update_end
need to use the cache information, but the cache information
has not been loaded.

Change-Id: I0d1da11bb559b7f0f9d4428b82573fb26916a933
Closes-Bug: #1420042

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-06-17 11:09:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/cisco_init_ops.py'], 'message': 'Fix cisco_csr_identifier_map.ipsec_site_conn_id

Some database engines require exact match of sizes of foreign keys
and referenced fields. Foreign key ipsec_site_conn_id of table
cisco_csr_identifier_map is varchar(64) but it references field
id varchar(36) of table ipsec_site_connections. This gives error
while running migration scripts in such databases.

This fix only applies to new installations. Existing databases will
be corrected by migration scripts introduced in
https://review.openstack.org/190569 - they will take care of resizing
the field and adjusting the model.

Change-Id: I6cc9625a2d96d1330b06eb727cc7fa5363c697b8
Depends-On: I384a9bbaba05ef94174b666bdcfb276eedc74134
Closes-Bug: #1463806
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cisco_csr_identifier_map.ipsec_site_conn_id

Some database engines require exact match of sizes of foreign keys
and referenced fields. Foreign key ipsec_site_conn_id of table
cisco_csr_identifier_map is varchar(64) but it references field
id varchar(36) of table ipsec_site_connections. This gives error
while running migration scripts in such databases.

This fix only applies to new installations. Existing databases will
be corrected by migration scripts introduced in
https://review.openstack.org/190569 - they will take care of resizing
the field and adjusting the model.

Change-Id: I6cc9625a2d96d1330b06eb727cc7fa5363c697b8
Depends-On: I384a9bbaba05ef94174b666bdcfb276eedc74134
Closes-Bug: #1463806

commit_message:
Update version for Liberty

Update the version for Liberty, switching from date-based versioning
to pre-versioning using SemVer. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/065211.html
and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067082.html
for details.

Change-Id: I6a35fa0dda798fad93b804d00a46af80f08d475c

commit_message:
Use correct rtslib namespace for newer versions

For rtslib-fb versions 2.1.52 and newer its own namespace (rtslib_fb) is
recommended instead of the older one (rtslib).

On versions with this new namespace a deprecation warning will be
thrown: "'rtslib' package name for rtslib-fb is deprecated, please
instead import 'rtslib_fb'"

This patch uses this new namespace when possible and falls back to the
older namespace if not.

Change-Id: I984105458da4d7b8736bf7c83919cbe5feb9c85a
Closes-Bug: #1460814

IPv6 urls are constructed and parsing them accordingly.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix noVNC console access for an IPv6 setup

Following a recent change in websocket proxy code
(commit: fdb73a2d445971c6158a80692c6f74094fd4193a),
novnc console access is not working for IPv6 addresses.
This patch fixes the issue by taking into account the way
IPv6 urls are constructed and parsing them accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1456963
Change-Id: Ia6c50be1e3cbe8a21f0a75b6a7cebd1712d311f8

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-19 14:16:34.000000000', 'files': ['shade/meta.py'], 'message': "Catch all exceptions around port for ip finding

If neutron does not work, then it's going to throw inside of list_ports,
which is going to send an OpenStackCloudException through search_ports,

Change-Id: Id25ff2688de55f4b39a145185269bc7b7ccb89eb

commit_message:
Catch all exceptions around port for ip finding

If neutron does not work, then it's going to throw inside of list_ports,
which is going to send an OpenStackCloudException through search_ports,
which is then not going to be caught by the NeutronClientException trap
here.

Change-Id: Id25ff2688de55f4b39a145185269bc7b7ccb89eb

commit_message:
Refactor node's and driver's vendor passthru to a common place

This patch is refactoring the node's and driver's vendor passthru in the
API to a common place (utils.py). Historically this code was duplicated
because each endpoint supported different things (driver's vendor
passhtru endpoing being always synchrounous and node's being always
asyncronous), since now both endpoints supports the same features and
the code is almost the same it makes sense to have it in a common place,
so changing once will affect both.

Related-Blueprint: ipxe-dynamic-config
Change-Id: I16be0c787993240e55ceb13b29bcb18c21151722

commit_message:
Change return value of [driver_]vendor_passthru to dict

This is a refactor patch that changes the return value of the
vendor_passthru() and driver_vendor_passthru() RPC methods to a dictionary
instead of a tuple. By doing that we make it easy to extend for future
improvements.

The RPC version was bumped to 1.29 by this change.

Change-Id: I8729bb85d97a563d4ec8409ecd0eba15dc0c51bc
Related-Blueprint: ipxe-dynamic-config

commit_message:

(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/185725/).

This patch excludes the 'util/tech-debt' folder which is
covered in patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/188316/.

commit_message:
Cinder container

Cinder is going to be split up into four containers.
- cinder-api
- cinder-scheduler
- cinder-volume
- cinder-backup

Co-Authored-By: Daneyon Hansen <danehans@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>

Implements: blueprint cinder-container
Closes-bug: #1460136

Change-Id: I688471151ffa54d547b9aa0f2f2e2ea7f68f288d

commit_message:
Galera container

This changes are providing support for galera cluster. It's important for
project to has got support for database cluster as a one of the steps to
providing High Avability(HA) in Kolla project

Change-Id: If51bb88ab05972d3b8aa8abbbbd2a5480213a10e
Implemented: blueprint galera-container

and

commit_message:
Fix beaker on Trusty and  update .gitreview file

* Update .gitreview file because of Puppet OpenStack modules project
  renaming.
* Fix Beaker tests on Ubuntu Trusty (newline added if secret)

We have to do that in a single patch because:
* project has been renamed so gitreview needs to be updated
* beaker jobs are voting

Co-Authored-By: Jeremy Stanley <fungi@yuggoth.org>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sebastien Badia <sbadia@redhat.com>

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-06-18 14:50:00.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'glance/common/wsgi.py', 'etc/glance-api.conf', 'doc/source/configuring.rst', 'glance/tests/functional/test_wsgi.py', 'etc/glance-registry.conf', 'glance/tests/unit/test_opts.py'], 'message': "Add client_socket_timeout option

Add a parameter to take advantage of the new(ish) eventlet socket timeout
behaviour.  Allows closing idle client connections after a period of
time, eg:

$ time nc localhost 9292
real    1m0.063s

Setting 'client_socket_timeout = 0' means do not timeout.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: 1371022
Change-Id: I9e7edcbf25ece61dc16b8cd5a8bef5ed9a14e3d6
"}]
commit_message:
Add client_socket_timeout option

Add a parameter to take advantage of the new(ish) eventlet socket timeout
behaviour.  Allows closing idle client connections after a period of
time, eg:

$ time nc localhost 9292
real    1m0.063s

Setting 'client_socket_timeout = 0' means do not timeout.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: 1371022
Change-Id: I9e7edcbf25ece61dc16b8cd5a8bef5ed9a14e3d6

subject: Change set_override() calls to use flags() instead
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-19 13:47:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/disk/test_ssp.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Change set_override() calls to use flags() instead

A few test cases used the set_override() method to change
the CONF variables instead of self.flags().  This goes against
the nova hacking rules since it can affect down stream test
cases.

Change-Id: Iff2b38cda5cd773887f36f765013fe4adfada35b
'}]
commit_message:
Change set_override() calls to use flags() instead

A few test cases used the set_override() method to change
the CONF variables instead of self.flags().  This goes against
the nova hacking rules since it can affect down stream test
cases.

Change-Id: Iff2b38cda5cd773887f36f765013fe4adfada35b

commit_message:
Add glance_store to projects.txt

glance requires glance_store but the requirements in glance_store on
master and stable/kilo don't line up with what's in
global-requirements.txt so add glance_store to projects.txt to sync
those up.

Conflicts:
        projects.txt

Closes-Bug: #1454695
Related-Bug: #1454467

Change-Id: Ib41b0c482edf39017f26e483cd3661ca5b540133
(cherry picked from commit 64091866112ac6b3590de8b6d3c036cc03dcd6e0)

commit_message:
Fixed issue with rabbitmq_ha_queues for Heat

We can see on HA deployments 'rabbitmq_ha_queues=False' in Heat
configuration file. In the result Heat doesn't work after the
destructive scenarios.

Change-Id: Iaa77b875928b94b79ab8a5e039cbbfe0d1908b35
Closes-Bug: #1465840

commit_message:
Revert "added a 'shared' column in FW policy table"

This reverts commit 00ec2e418e7b8b645bd4f9993433f58aac7f6074.

The same change went in with commit 92b9e4071a359b4516c1530af9cb74b7d5fa35e3
a few hours earlier. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/190023/4

This commit is completely redundant and unnecessary.

commit_message:
Fixed issue with rabbitmq_ha_queues for Heat

We can see on HA deployments 'rabbitmq_ha_queues=False' in Heat
configuration file. In the result Heat doesn't work after the
destructive scenarios.

Change-Id: I7b800e7414fa40f1b23690de6e03d36bd62fe161
Closes-Bug: #1466810

commit_message:
Clean bdms and networks after deleting shelved VM

After deleting the shelved offloaded instance with user volumes,
the bdms and networks info should be cleanup. This patch use local
deleting to cleanup the instance info.

(cherry picked from commit 54f4600c82241ad6ae6768d3dcd1e1755dac4ddc)
Conflicts:
	nova/compute/api.py
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

Closes-bug: #1307791
change-Id: Id32385df5b20903d7a019c3590432f3fb1133f90

Commit 1668fef9cabea6a23023aab6b97617b4368b14d6 corrected many
wrongs that we have with the oslo.vmware exceptions. The problem
is that that patch broke nova. This patch addresses the code in
Nova to enable it to upgrade to a oslo.vmware package that has
better exception handling.

The patch does the following:
1. Ensures that place that treated VMwareDriverException will also
   treat VimFaultException. This will ensure that the code is backward
   and forward compatible
2. Fixes unit tests to ensure the above

Note: I have tested the code with oslo.vmware 0.13.0

Closes-Bug: #1459021

Change-Id: I8da60c8e31aad83f75218a3c9d49a7cd515f47f2
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: better exception handling

Commit 1668fef9cabea6a23023aab6b97617b4368b14d6 corrected many
wrongs that we have with the oslo.vmware exceptions. The problem
is that that patch broke nova. This patch addresses the code in
Nova to enable it to upgrade to a oslo.vmware package that has
better exception handling.

The patch does the following:
1. Ensures that place that treated VMwareDriverException will also
   treat VimFaultException. This will ensure that the code is backward
   and forward compatible
2. Fixes unit tests to ensure the above

Note: I have tested the code with oslo.vmware 0.13.0

Closes-Bug: #1459021

Change-Id: I8da60c8e31aad83f75218a3c9d49a7cd515f47f2

subject: Adding paramiko injections check to blacklist functions
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-06-18 20:46:56.000000000', 'files': ['examples/paramiko_injection.py', 'bandit/config/bandit.yaml', 'tests/test_functional.py'], 'message': 'Adding paramiko injections check to blacklist functions

This commit adds a check for paramiko.exec_command, as it sends
the command directly to shell, and may be vulnerable to a command
injection vulnerability if called with untrusted input.  This
commit also checks paramiko.invoke_shell, which may be similarly
vulnerable.

Change-Id: I51ce997073eae94c910483790f172afdbf407e7e
'}]
commit_message:
Adding paramiko injections check to blacklist functions

This commit adds a check for paramiko.exec_command, as it sends
the command directly to shell, and may be vulnerable to a command
injection vulnerability if called with untrusted input.  This
commit also checks paramiko.invoke_shell, which may be similarly
vulnerable.

Change-Id: I51ce997073eae94c910483790f172afdbf407e7e

Fixes nova rescue / unrescue

Removes extra argument passed to _create_root_vhd by the rescue_instance
method.
Fixes the arguments passed from driver to vmops for unrescue.
Avoids deletion of 'None' file during unrescue.

commit_message:
Removing unnecessary test setting of dashboards

HORIZON_CONFIG is still being used to set default values for
dashboards and default_dashboard. This method of specifying these
is deprecated. All of these default behaviors are now covered in
the enabled directory. Removing them to remove seeing the
deprecation warning every time tests run.

Closes-Bug: #1466671
Change-Id: Ifd833288f0bf2992bd810a93a74a799232f119ab

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox fails even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem by passing (upper case and lower case)
http_proxy, https_proxy and no_proxy from environment to tox.

See: commit 2d02ebb775ec44a14e325c56d4a901c5705fbb94

Change-Id: Ib7964fd5ea4fb8398cdb4cd94a70fe7fae49f973
'}]
commit_message:
Pass proxy environment variables to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox fails even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fixes this problem by passing (upper case and lower case)
http_proxy, https_proxy and no_proxy from environment to tox.

See: commit 2d02ebb775ec44a14e325c56d4a901c5705fbb94

Change-Id: Ib7964fd5ea4fb8398cdb4cd94a70fe7fae49f973

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-06-15 23:30:04.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_complex_query_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_list_meters_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_list_resources_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_statistics_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_alarm_scenarios.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix unicode/bytes issues in API v2 tests

* HTTP body type is bytes: fix tests to use bytes strings.
* test_list_resources_scenarios: on Python 3, base64.encodestring() returns
  bytes whereas the test expects bytes; decode the result from ASCII.
* tox.ini: add the following API v2 tests to Python 3.4:

  - test_alarm_scenarios.TestAlarms.test_alarms_query_with_timestamp
  - test_complex_query_scenarios.TestQueryMetersController.test_query_with_isotime
  - test_list_resources_scenarios.TestListResources.test_with_invalid_resource_id

Change-Id: I8258c2d17fbc1236f4bcda40bff93a93bddf13e2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unicode/bytes issues in API v2 tests

* HTTP body type is bytes: fix tests to use bytes strings.
* test_list_resources_scenarios: on Python 3, base64.encodestring() returns
  bytes whereas the test expects bytes; decode the result from ASCII.

commit_message:
Add 'docker' to the list of known hypervisor types

nova-docker is out of tree, but it's starting to be used by people, and
being able to use a docker-specific hypervisor type can be quite useful
(in mixed-hypervisor environments, for instance).

Change-Id: I5a50de6bf73372f1ab999fd977aa58b33ffacfb9
(cherry picked from commit 2a21fcd073b44eb32f821fe3eb938dba7c34f6bc)

subject: Running with 'LIBS_FROM_GIT=pbr' causes failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-18 16:30:44.000000000', 'files': ['lib/infra'], 'message': 'Running with 'LIBS_FROM_GIT=pbr' causes failure

If you have 'pbr' in your LIBS_FROM_GIT list, then the following error
occurs:

+ cd /opt/stack/requirements
/home/ubuntu/devstack/inc/python: line 229: cd: /opt/stack/requirements:
No such file or directory

This is due to commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/192494 moving
the clone of 'requirements' after 'setup_lib "pbr"' - which depends
on the directory existing.

The fix is to move the clone back before the pbr section,
leaving the pip_install for afterwards.

Change-Id: I04bd887d3c8157533f79cb737d040a5803c7a9dd
Closes-Bug: #1466577
'}]
commit_message:
Running with 'LIBS_FROM_GIT=pbr' causes failure

If you have 'pbr' in your LIBS_FROM_GIT list, then the following error
occurs:

+ cd /opt/stack/requirements
/home/ubuntu/devstack/inc/python: line 229: cd: /opt/stack/requirements:
No such file or directory

This is due to commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/192494 moving
the clone of 'requirements' after 'setup_lib "pbr"' - which depends
on the directory existing.

The fix is to move the clone back before the pbr section,
leaving the pip_install for afterwards.

Change-Id: I04bd887d3c8157533f79cb737d040a5803c7a9dd
Closes-Bug: #1466577

subject: Strip markers from test requirements.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-19 01:59:45.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/packaging.py', 'pbr/tests/testpackage/test-requirements.txt', 'pbr/hooks/backwards.py'], 'message': "Strip markers from test requirements.

Setuptools doesn't [yet] support markeres in tests_require parameters
to setup(). While we need to get that fixed, we also need to support
syncing marker constrained requirements from global-requirements.

Since version constraints are needed to successfully port to Python3
this won't be a long term viable solution: but few of our test-only
dependencies require version constraints, so we can do this in the
interim. The ones that do - such as python-mysql - we're either
moving away from, or centralising them into optional dependencies
on other packages where the tests_require limitation shouldn't apply.

Change-Id: I31adaf35c8d7b72fe3f8c9242cc356fe34d537e8
"}]
commit_message:
Strip markers from test requirements.

Setuptools doesn't [yet] support markeres in tests_require parameters
to setup(). While we need to get that fixed, we also need to support
syncing marker constrained requirements from global-requirements.

Since version constraints are needed to successfully port to Python3
this won't be a long term viable solution: but few of our test-only
dependencies require version constraints, so we can do this in the
interim. The ones that do - such as python-mysql - we're either
moving away from, or centralising them into optional dependencies
on other packages where the tests_require limitation shouldn't apply.

Change-Id: I31adaf35c8d7b72fe3f8c9242cc356fe34d537e8

commit_message:

A simple test if some hardware meter has been created inside
Ceilometer. That means Ceilometer has been able to poll the

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/92370/

subject: Allowing to optionally run sensors-detect
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-24 10:47:54.000000000', 'files': ['elements/snmpd/README.md', 'elements/snmpd/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/67-snmpd'], 'message': 'Allowing to optionally run sensors-detect

Allowing to optionally run sensors-detect feature in lm-sensors.
If passing run_sensors_detect parameter through heat, sensors-detect
will be invoked with default input.
According to documentation this step is mandatory, though sensors
might be visible after installing lm-sensors without running detect.

Change-Id: I8e361b60fce8215d0e4666c8c38c86985dda8261
'}]
commit_message:
Allowing to optionally run sensors-detect

Allowing to optionally run sensors-detect feature in lm-sensors.
If passing run_sensors_detect parameter through heat, sensors-detect
will be invoked with default input.
According to documentation this step is mandatory, though sensors
might be visible after installing lm-sensors without running detect.

Change-Id: I8e361b60fce8215d0e4666c8c38c86985dda8261

to new one.

Roles are created as part of register endpoints now.

Depends on:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/132983/

Change-Id: I90c5fd909459e2e41641fd49ce6ea00cc554de8e

commit_message:
Switch to os-cloud-config register-endpoints

Switching to os-cloud-config register-endpoints. Changing interface
to new one.

Endpoints will be created exatly the same as before, so this change
is backwards compatible.

Roles are created as part of register endpoints now.

Depends on:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/132983/
Without this patch there is failure while uploading image
using Overcloud Glance.

Change-Id: I90c5fd909459e2e41641fd49ce6ea00cc554de8e

commit_message:
Replace xrange() with six.moves.range()

Add "from six.moves import range" to replace the builtin range()
function with six.moves.range() to always create an iterator, instead of
creating a temporary list.

Replace "xrange" with "range".

Don't add the import for ranges of 1024 items or less.

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: If618b4e810e444f7eb6592bb2398805e9d14d548

commit_message:
libvirt: adjust test_get_disk_bus test to ImageMetaProps object

test_get_disk_bus test is incompatible with the new
ImageMetaProps object, as None values for the hw_cdrom_bus field
are not allowed.
Adjusting the test to not set the properties instead,
as it has the same effect.

Change-Id: I1ef5c235fcf7fbc3f2780c3b93344c9506b952f7

commit_message:
objects: raise a meaningful exception when validating VIF properties

Raise an UnsupportedVIFModel exception in the fields object
when validating the VIF values.

This will allow to re-raise a meaningful exception.

Closes-Bug: #1463655
Change-Id: I5dadfbfa1a7970977cffaa63a4cbff663edb7197

commit_message:
libvirt: adjust os_command_empty test to ImageMetaProps object

test_get_guest_config_os_command_empty is incompatible with the new
ImageMetaProps object, as empty values are not for os_command_line field
are not allowed.
Adjusting the test to test against an empty image properties, instead of
an empty vaule, as it has the same effect.

Closes-Bug: #1463651
Change-Id: I5f493e3d923544498dde22ee92d83d71460767e1

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-15 08:32:36.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/conf_fixture.py', 'cinder/ssh_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'cinder/utils.py'], 'message': "Fix Python 3 issues in utils

* Replace string.split(key_file, ',') with key_file.split(','):
  the string.split() function was removed in Python 3, use the
  str.split() method instead
* Fix conf_fixture: import backup_enable_progress_timer and
  backup_swift_enable_progress_timer options. This change is required
  to run tests using testtools (it's now possible yet to run tests on
  Python 3 using testr).
* hash_file(): use b'' (bytes) for the sentinel, not '' (unicode), when
  reading the input binary file
* test_hash_file() requires a binary file (bytes), not a text file
  (unicode)
* Get the builtin open() function from six.moves.builtins instead of
  getting it from __builtin__ to mock the open() function. The
  __builtin__ module was renamed to builtins in Python 3.
* sanitize_hostname(): on Python 3, decode back the hostname from Latin1
  to work on a native string (Unicode)
* replace reduce() with six.moves.reduce(): the Python 2 builtin
  reduce() function was moved to the functools module in Python 3
* convert_version_to_str(): fix integer division, use a//b, not a/b
* convert_version_to_str(): replace reduce() with ''.join() with map(str)

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: If7b8f50c6a8b0a5044c2c7108b2b0293dddafff3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Python 3 issues in utils

* Replace string.split(key_file, ',') with key_file.split(','):
  the string.split() function was removed in Python 3, use the
  str.split() method instead
* Fix conf_fixture: import backup_enable_progress_timer and
  backup_swift_enable_progress_timer options. This change is required
  to run tests using testtools (it's now possible yet to run tests on
  Python 3 using testr).
* hash_file(): use b'' (bytes) for the sentinel, not '' (unicode), when
  reading the input binary file
* test_hash_file() requires a binary file (bytes), not a text file
  (unicode)
* Get the builtin open() function from six.moves.builtins instead of
  getting it from __builtin__ to mock the open() function. The
  __builtin__ module was renamed to builtins in Python 3.
* sanitize_hostname(): on Python 3, decode back the hostname from Latin1
  to work on a native string (Unicode)
* replace reduce() with six.moves.reduce(): the Python 2 builtin
  reduce() function was moved to the functools module in Python 3
* convert_version_to_str(): fix integer division, use a//b, not a/b
* convert_version_to_str(): replace reduce() with ''.join() with map(str)

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: If7b8f50c6a8b0a5044c2c7108b2b0293dddafff3

subject: Close connections from SegmentedIterable on client disconnection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-18 16:17:12.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/request_helpers.py'], 'message': 'Close connections from SegmentedIterable on client disconnection

SegmentedIterable is used to retrieve segments from DLO and SLO objects. When
a client disconnect during the download of a segment, the connection to the
object server is not closed.

This commit add a close() method to SegmentedIterable that is called on a
client disconnection. Thus, proxy server does not leak connections anymore.

Change-Id: I598fb7c50f626bb065f70f62b6f9d32d6b18749f
Closes-Bug: #1466549
'}]
commit_message:
Close connections from SegmentedIterable on client disconnection

SegmentedIterable is used to retrieve segments from DLO and SLO objects. When
a client disconnect during the download of a segment, the connection to the
object server is not closed.

This commit add a close() method to SegmentedIterable that is called on a
client disconnection. Thus, proxy server does not leak connections anymore.

Change-Id: I598fb7c50f626bb065f70f62b6f9d32d6b18749f
Closes-Bug: #1466549

commit_message:
Drop L suffix from long integers

Replace 123L with 123 to make Cinder code compatible with Python 3.

This patch was generated by the long operation of the sixer tool:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sixer

Manual changes:

* hp_3par_common: bump version

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I3086d3e3d9c3ede358313bdd43d1eee9cfdafe15

commit_message:
libvirt: handle code=38 + sigkill (ebusy) in destroy()

Handle the libvirt error during destroy when the sigkill fails due to an
EBUSY. This is taken from a comment by danpb in the bug report as a
potential workaround.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Berrange (berrange@redhat.com)

Closes-Bug: #1353939

Change-Id: I128bf6b939fbbc85df521fd3fe23c3c6f93b1b2c

subject: Reattach the original configdrive during unrescue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-19 10:58:34.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/vmops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_vmops.py'], 'message': 'Reattach the original configdrive during unrescue

At the moment, the instance original configdrive is not reattached
when the instance is unrescued. This behavior can be undesired.

This patch fixes the issue by reattaching the instance configdrive
during the unrescue operation, in case it exists.

Change-Id: I82e2b31139d947a4201c770db37d84b83bba282a
(cherry picked from commit 3a2b460c1e552812c8e7694954c12dfe3b9e3a97)
'}]
commit_message:
Reattach the original configdrive during unrescue

At the moment, the instance original configdrive is not reattached
when the instance is unrescued. This behavior can be undesired.

This patch fixes the issue by reattaching the instance configdrive
during the unrescue operation, in case it exists.

Change-Id: I82e2b31139d947a4201c770db37d84b83bba282a
(cherry picked from commit 3a2b460c1e552812c8e7694954c12dfe3b9e3a97)

commit_message:
Reattach the original configdrive during unrescue

At the moment, the instance original configdrive is not reattached
when the instance is unrescued. This behavior can be undesired.

This patch fixes the issue by reattaching the instance configdrive
during the unrescue operation, in case it exists.

Change-Id: I82e2b31139d947a4201c770db37d84b83bba282a

commit_message:
Fixes nova rescue / unrescue

Removes extra argument passed to _create_root_vhd by the rescue_instance
method.
Fixes the arguments passed from driver to vmops for unrescue.
Avoids deletion of 'None' file during unrescue.

Change-Id: I1636783c2681392654c6a3fcf7dd0997d6b46e1b

subject: Use UPLINK net type instead of LOCAL
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 156, 'name': 'Ryu Ishimoto', 'email': 'ryu@midokura.com', 'username': 'ryu-midokura'}, {'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 7505, 'name': 'Jaume Devesa', 'email': 'devvesa@gmail.com', 'username': 'devesa'}, {'_account_id': 8837, 'name': 'Joe Mills', 'email': 'joe.h.mills@gmail.com', 'username': 'joemido'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-06-18 10:52:37.000000000', 'files': ['midonet/neutron/db/provider_network_db.py', 'midonet/neutron/tests/unit/test_midonet_plugin_v2.py', 'midonet/neutron/common/constants.py'], 'message': "Use UPLINK net type instead of LOCAL

Previously, 'LOCAL' network type was used to determine whether a
Neutron network is an uplink network or not. This caused a problem in
Neutron because, following the behavior of ML2, all external networks
when 'providernet' extension is enabled usually have a type, and
typically configured to have 'LOCAL' as the default, unless explicitly
specified, making it impossible to differentiate uplink and external
networks.  To get around it, this patch defines a new type 'UPLINK' to
replace 'LOCAL'.  Also, instead of validating against the unsupported
types, just log and continue.  This way, 'providernet' extension could
continue to be used with Horizon, until it is patched to accept uplink
type.

Change-Id: Ifb0dbe8d2c86456b11064c786f8ebe6e4126d206
Implements: MNP-150
"}]
commit_message:
Use UPLINK net type instead of LOCAL

Previously, 'LOCAL' network type was used to determine whether a
Neutron network is an uplink network or not. This caused a problem in
Neutron because, following the behavior of ML2, all external networks
when 'providernet' extension is enabled usually have a type, and
typically configured to have 'LOCAL' as the default, unless explicitly
specified, making it impossible to differentiate uplink and external
networks.  To get around it, this patch defines a new type 'UPLINK' to
replace 'LOCAL'.  Also, instead of validating against the unsupported
types, just log and continue.  This way, 'providernet' extension could
continue to be used with Horizon, until it is patched to accept uplink
type.

Change-Id: Ifb0dbe8d2c86456b11064c786f8ebe6e4126d206
Implements: MNP-150

subject: Make test_rest keystone cache work with keystonemiddleware 2.0
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-06-19 09:31:09.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/test_rest.py'], 'message': 'Make test_rest keystone cache work with keystonemiddleware 2.0

Token cache keys in keystonemiddleware 2.0 are sha256 hashes of the
token key. This is _not_ the case in keystonemiddleware <2.0. This
change adjusts the FakeMemcache to support both types of key.

keystonemiddleware also breaks WebTest linting, so turn that off
until there has been progress on fixing that.

Change-Id: I28b5dbfbc915d424c74993732ddc041e528903e6
'}]
commit_message:
Make test_rest keystone cache work with keystonemiddleware 2.0

Token cache keys in keystonemiddleware 2.0 are sha256 hashes of the
token key. This is _not_ the case in keystonemiddleware <2.0. This
change adjusts the FakeMemcache to support both types of key.

keystonemiddleware also breaks WebTest linting, so turn that off
until there has been progress on fixing that.

Change-Id: I28b5dbfbc915d424c74993732ddc041e528903e6

commit_message:

Add instructions on how change a path for
Ubuntu system packages.
Add to new features that the Ubuntu
system packages can now be downloaded
from official Ubuntu mirrors or
from internal repos.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-02 06:13:45.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Ensure tests run under python2.7

tox uses whatever python version that tox ran with as the default python
version for environments (py27,py3x, etc are given a more specific
default).

Debian's python-tox (for example) uses python3, but we require python2.7
- and a naive `apt-get install python-tox; tox -epep8` fails with
py3-related errors on Debian.

This change explicitly sets `basepython = python2.7` in several testing
environments that would otherwise have used the default basepython.

Change-Id: I377ac6d72dec5b85c105d8a1a74f6974efb84dcf
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure tests run under python2.7

tox uses whatever python version that tox ran with as the default python
version for environments (py27,py3x, etc are given a more specific
default).

Debian's python-tox (for example) uses python3, but we require python2.7
- and a naive `apt-get install python-tox; tox -epep8` fails with
py3-related errors on Debian.

This change explicitly sets `basepython = python2.7` in several testing
environments that would otherwise have used the default basepython.

Change-Id: I377ac6d72dec5b85c105d8a1a74f6974efb84dcf

We need to be able to download packages from
various repositories taking into account repository
priority. We need this for patching story.

This patch introduces MULTI_MIRROR_CENTOS variable
which is supposed to have the following format:

  "name1,url1,pri1 name2,url2,pri2"

In case when pri is not defined it will be set to 10,
for example
  "name1,url1"

  "name1,url1,10"

cases USE_MIRROR=msk|srt|none removing unused variables.

It is supposed that USE_MIRROR=none is only used for

Change-Id: I84a893a32194f0d6f5c2727af373f680fae1aaae
Closes-Bug: #1446293
'}]
commit_message:
Added priorities for centos repos

We need to be able to download packages from
various repositories taking into account repository
priority. We need this for patching story.

This patch introduces MULTI_MIRROR_CENTOS variable
which is supposed to have the following format:

  "name1,url1,pri1 name2,url2,pri2"

In case when pri is not defined it will be set to 10,
for example
  "name1,url1"
        is equal to:
  "name1,url1,10"

Besides, this patch introduces uniformity for all those
cases USE_MIRROR=msk|srt|none removing unused variables.

It is supposed that USE_MIRROR=none is only used for
building Centos mirror not for building ISO.

Change-Id: I84a893a32194f0d6f5c2727af373f680fae1aaae
Closes-Bug: #1446293

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-06-17 16:11:55.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'etc/openstack_deploy/user_group_vars.yml'], 'message': "Implement service_region user_group_var

Currently each service has an individual service_region var
which needs to be set when setting up a region that is
different to the default.

This patch implements a user_group_var called 'service_region'
which can be used to set the region for all services.

The AIO bootstrap script is also altered to set the
service_region in the user config.

Change-Id: I5ed216916f667506ffed900a01744dad973221bf
Closes-Bug: #1463366
"}]
commit_message:
Implement service_region user_group_var

Currently each service has an individual service_region var
which needs to be set when setting up a region that is
different to the default.

This patch implements a user_group_var called 'service_region'
which can be used to set the region for all services.

The AIO bootstrap script is also altered to set the
service_region in the user config.

Change-Id: I5ed216916f667506ffed900a01744dad973221bf
Closes-Bug: #1463366

commit_message:
Update rabbitmq to v3.5.3-1

This change updates rabbitmq to the latest stable rabbitmq release
the new version is v3.5.3-1 and is being done to ensure that we are
maintaining a stable release with updated bug fixes and patches.

Closes-Bug: #1466589
Change-Id: I6d8a367a896194d3a1f8f64fc04e08a06078d1ec
(cherry picked from commit f9febc97b289c36b4396783558d4eaba38f78b81)

commit_message:
Allow protocol to be set per endpoint-type

If services are running behind an SSL terminating LB you will want to
differentiate between protocol on internalURL and publicURL endpoints.
This patch allows you to set the values of protocol per endpoint type,
but doesn't change the default behaviour which is to have it set in one
var.

Change-Id: I7a74c85a8841499623746586ae27103a71c6fec0
Partial-Bug: #1399383
(cherry picked from commit 1a2907c6a137bc4bc110f971f34904a20a7a5ad4)

commit_message:
Nodes metadata filtration added

Filtering of private nodes metadata added to statsender.
This patchset is only for syncronization of code in stable/6.1 and master.
Current whitelists implementation is not fit to fix this issue due to
meatdata data structure. Filtration by whitelists is going to be implemened
in: https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1466121

Change-Id: I2c5f39e0ac0f77c281db444933ac54723c2645c7
Closes-Bug: #1466140

commit_message:
Split environment file into component parts

This patch splits the monolithic openstack_environment file
into component parts, making them easier to understand and
manipulate.

Change-Id: I45887599bd887a272798047f9ad650d4811ab380
Closes-Bug: #1463862
(cherry picked from commit ecf77297955922d31dfaa3e6570bd6589f759b2f)

commit_message:
Block additionalProperties on Nova API tests

Now Nova team is allowing additional properties with microversions
only, that means Nova v2 and v2.1 should not contain additional
properties forever. In addition, we should not allow vender-specific
properties for OpenStack interoperability.
This patch disables additionalProperties for blocking such properties
for v2 and v2.1 API.

Change-Id: Ica929c402a3d042ae751302384e68853eb28b405

This change fixes the py_pkgs plugin so that if the plugin loads an empty file
or if there is an exception raised when loading the contents of a yaml file
the item will be skipped and no bad data will be passed onto the rest of the
plugin.

Change-Id: Ica3af42d95e7f3140e437e388b25f41bc14db47f
Closes-Bug: #1464673
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed empty yaml load

This change fixes the py_pkgs plugin so that if the plugin loads an empty file
or if there is an exception raised when loading the contents of a yaml file
the item will be skipped and no bad data will be passed onto the rest of the
plugin.

Change-Id: Ica3af42d95e7f3140e437e388b25f41bc14db47f
Closes-Bug: #1464673

Build doc/source/index.rst dynamically based on the subdirectories in specs/

commit_message:
Dynamic index.rst for specs

Build doc/source/index.rst dynamically based on the subdirectories in specs/
directory that correspond to release version numbers. This allows to submit
specs for new releases without manually creating a toctree.

Header and footer templates added for building doc/source/index.rst file.

Change-Id: I1985c1e770be3430a3699832d7b5b056dbf1faa9

commit_message:
Revert "Change default IO scheduler to deadline"

This reverts commit ec917ae36d2a1b482b189f29483cfdbc5ce700be.

As shown by simple benchmark on Launchpad report[1], the change has decreased the performance.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1418126/comments/14

Change-Id: I087952152ff522c343bb209413c9905b2d4b1f29

commit_message:
Increase threshold for running processes for zabbix

Modern OS can run much more than 300 processes, so zabbix warns every
time about it. Increased value to 500.

Change-Id: Icbcfa2009e312a66c84f3de5f16b53c95052553b
Closes-Bug: #1434118

Currently dnsmasq tries to resolve locally a host named
test.mydomain.local instead of forwarding this request to the local dns

Change-Id: I5892fddaffa0dc619f0a54ac0f9fac34055b9b3f

commit_message:
Do not add @domain_name to dnsmasq.conf if it equals 'local'

Currently dnsmasq tries to resolve locally a host named
test.mydomain.local instead of forwarding this request to the local dns
server.

Change-Id: I5892fddaffa0dc619f0a54ac0f9fac34055b9b3f
Closes-Bug: 1411425
(cherry picked from commit 3ca3ef5aae68b84ec8b9beb55e552bdd70d42599)

commit_message:
We forgot two of our cookbooks and our specs

In the move to the OpenStack namespace we forgot two of our cookbooks,
and our specs repo.

- cookbook-openstack-database
- cookbook-openstack-identity
- openstack-chef-specs

This patch brings them across for us.

Change-Id: I268a0d73dc2427db45cf5c91c6e9ee4e8b3e1d9b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-11 12:39:13.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Rename python-keystoneclient-saml2 to keystoneauth

With the ``keystoneauth`` library to be released soon we want our SAML2
authentication plugins to depend on that library, instead of
``python-keystoneclient``. For that we propose changing repository name to
``keystoneauth-saml2`` so it reflects proper hierarchy between
libraries.

This library has never had a release so will not have an impact on
users.

Change-Id: Iddf0e280c1b3513db0700c65e0f912da93119286
'}]
commit_message:
Rename python-keystoneclient-saml2 to keystoneauth

With the ``keystoneauth`` library to be released soon we want our SAML2
authentication plugins to depend on that library, instead of
``python-keystoneclient``. For that we propose changing repository name to
``keystoneauth-saml2`` so it reflects proper hierarchy between
libraries.

This library has never had a release so will not have an impact on
users.

Change-Id: Iddf0e280c1b3513db0700c65e0f912da93119286

commit_message:
Spec to add 'libvirt_net' as vif type to novas libvirt driver.

This is required in order to attach libvirt manged kvm guests to
a libvirt managed network.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-network-vif

commit_message:
convergence: (temporary) convert int entity_id to string

We plan to change the schema of entity_id to int (as all
resource.id's are int and represent the stack.id as "0".

Until that change is done, this is a "quick fix" to make things
work.

Change-Id: I99ddc14d68b7cc0869d5bb636c06f4498344cf3d

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-06-15 09:22:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/db/test_ipam.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/base.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/db/test_migrations.py', 'neutron/tests/common/base.py'], 'message': 'Use PyMySQL in MySQL related functional/fullstack tests

mysql-python driver has been replaced by PyMySQL driver[1] in neutron
code but MySQL related functional/fullstack tests try to use
mysql-python driver because of MySQLOpportunisticTestCase[2] and tests
are skipped because mysql-python driver is no more available.

This change provides a backend implementation for mysql+pymysql, a base
base testcase MySQLTestCase[2] using mysql+pymysql implementation
(currently oslo.db provides none of them but will in the future) and
replaces MySQLOpportunisticTestCase with MySQLTestCase.

[1] I73e0fdb6eca70e7d029a40a2f6f17a7c0797a21d
[2] neutron.tests.common.base

Closes-Bug: #1463980
Change-Id: Ic5c1d12ab75443e1cc290a7447eeb4b452b4a9dd
'}]
commit_message:
Use PyMySQL in MySQL related functional/fullstack tests

mysql-python driver has been replaced by PyMySQL driver[1] in neutron
code but MySQL related functional/fullstack tests try to use
mysql-python driver because of MySQLOpportunisticTestCase[2] and tests
are skipped because mysql-python driver is no more available.

This change provides a backend implementation for mysql+pymysql, a base
base testcase MySQLTestCase[2] using mysql+pymysql implementation
(currently oslo.db provides none of them but will in the future) and
replaces MySQLOpportunisticTestCase with MySQLTestCase.

[1] I73e0fdb6eca70e7d029a40a2f6f17a7c0797a21d
[2] neutron.tests.common.base

Closes-Bug: #1463980
Change-Id: Ic5c1d12ab75443e1cc290a7447eeb4b452b4a9dd
