[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-03-09 20:04:21.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/neutron/utilsv2.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/neutron/test_utilsv2.py'], 'message': 'Fixes Hyper-V agent stateful security group rules

Hyper-V does not allow stateful ACLs with "ANY" protocol, meaning that
security group rules which allows "ANY" protocol must be split up
into separate rules for each protocol.
Also, Hyper-V does not allow stateful ICMP rules, which means ICMP rules
must be added both inbound and outbound.

Closes-Bug: #1362676

Change-Id: I0d4a6ebc6023ea616cf92539273b8b36a6b24ae0
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V agent stateful security group rules

Hyper-V does not allow stateful ACLs with "ANY" protocol, meaning that
security group rules which allows "ANY" protocol must be split up
into separate rules for each protocol.
Also, Hyper-V does not allow stateful ICMP rules, which means ICMP rules
must be added both inbound and outbound.

Closes-Bug: #1362676

Change-Id: I0d4a6ebc6023ea616cf92539273b8b36a6b24ae0

commit_message:
Path to mysql-wss script in DB backup/restore doc

In the Fuel 6.1 Operations Guide, path to mysql-wss is incorrect in
db-backup-ops.rst file.

It is now /usr/lib/ocf/resource.d/fuel/mysql-wss, not
/usr/lib/ocf/resource.d/mirantis/mysql-wss.

Change-Id: I0aa561a9803493da45e0b023b5623f540e03de08
Closes-bug: 1464755
(cherry picked from commit a817f83b26c3a8f8dd2932a589feee5631ae96d1)

commit_message:
Add delete_network retres for v2

For plugin V2, earlier patches to have retries on error in
delete_network method was never applied.

The patches are: 0126e13 and d2fe565

Add the same retry logic for v2 in this patch.

Change-Id: I4db62889a29678f1cdccd660bb6dfc4b9d049511
Fixes: MNP-151

commit_message:
Updating Case Studies - Creating dashboard case studies

This creates case studies for both Alice and Bob in the Dashboard
chapter. This outlines Alice's work around HTST, sub domains, and
other configurations. Bob's case studies are coming, however
Alice's can be used in the meantime. Linking through the Dashboard
chapter as well.

Co-Authored-By: Dave Walker <email@daviey.com>
Change-Id: I6569d0dcb0fc6e0ba07a54e3631b58f76e5857ef
Partial-Bug: #1349540

subject: remove extra_extensions config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-11 01:59:53.000000000', 'files': ['midonet/neutron/plugin.py', 'midonet/neutron/tests/unit/test_midonet_plugin.py', 'midonet/neutron/common/config.py'], 'message': 'remove extra_extensions config

The list of available extensions does not need to be configurable
due to a recent decision to separate the plugin packages, each of
which will have a static list of supported extensions.

This patch removes that configuration option, and adds all of the
supported extensions to the static list.

Change-Id: Ib5cf3e464bebf77815e0aa896bea187bd43b5ddf
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove extra_extensions config

The list of available extensions does not need to be configurable
due to a recent decision to separate the plugin packages, each of
which will have a static list of supported extensions.

This patch removes that configuration option, and adds all of the
supported extensions to the static list.

Change-Id: Ib5cf3e464bebf77815e0aa896bea187bd43b5ddf
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded http in URL in sahara exercise script

The script hardcoded http://$SERVICE_HOST/... which failed
when SSL or tls-proxy was enabled. Calculate the protocol
based on enabled services instead.

Change-Id: I192eeeafe7bf4dc5cbd382c505ffb9307651d78a

The iptables service files are no longer included by default on

commit_message:
Make sure iptables-services is installed

The iptables service files are no longer included by default on
Fedora.  This causes the systemctl calls in fixup_stuff.sh to fail
when disabling firewalld in favor of iptables.

Change-Id: If37691d03e3d07ca8b53c541717081beeb184c16
Closes-Bug: #1462347

subject: Remove file-driver special no-async abilities
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-17 16:21:18.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/file.py'], 'message': 'Remove file-driver special no-async abilities

To enable a following commit to unify the `run_watchers` of
the various drivers we need to make the file driver method
look more like the other drivers, which means removing the
special no-async ability and having it use the standard get
a future and wait on it to return (and repeat).

Change-Id: I14d227a0e6a80da80eb2580b1780ae1dba128b21
'}]
commit_message:
Remove file-driver special no-async abilities

To enable a following commit to unify the `run_watchers` of
the various drivers we need to make the file driver method
look more like the other drivers, which means removing the
special no-async ability and having it use the standard get
a future and wait on it to return (and repeat).

Change-Id: I14d227a0e6a80da80eb2580b1780ae1dba128b21

commit_message:
neutron: remove deprecated allow_duplicate_networks config option

Commit 4306d9190f49e7fadf88669d18effedabc880d3b deprecated the
allow_duplicate_networks config option in Kilo and marked it for removal
in Liberty where the default behavior is to just allow duplicate
networks.

This simply removes the option and checks/tests around it being False.

DocImpact: Removed neutron.allow_duplicate_networks config option. The
           behavior in Liberty is now to simply allow duplicate
           networks.

Change-Id: Icb3510bcf0c30e11d0304a86ead91a43f37602ec

Add image operation failed will lead to rollback operation,

commit_message:
logging failed exception info for add image operation

Add image operation failed will lead to rollback operation,
delete this image if it was created.
If this operation throws some exception, previous one will be
overwritten so that we cannot elegantly trace the problem occurs.
We could log failed exception info before rollback operation.

Change-Id: Ie2efcedbd647adb827f40c2ef6673c615046c6a4
modified:   glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py

commit_message:
Make the 3PAR drivers honor the pool in create

Updated 3PAR's usage of the extra spec setting hp3par:cpg. This
setting is ignored in Kilo; the hp3par_cpg setting in cinder.conf
should be used instead.
Closes-Bug: 1434292

Change-Id: Idac6b7b2aaa04e06bc9066a38d52683da70395ee

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I7344c794b73aca1e0dcad681a4c43e3a66dd2eb3

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Iaf9247f90ba26615d02e5431d6bc98f22351caa7

subject: Allow ``OS_DEBUG`` environment variable to specify log level.
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-06-17 18:43:53.000000000', 'files': ['oslotest/log.py', 'tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslotest/base.py'], 'message': "Allow ``OS_DEBUG`` environment variable to specify log level.

Preserve original behavior when ``OS_DEBUG`` is ``True``, but if variable
is set to a valid log level, such as 'WARNING' use that level instead to

FakeLogger.

Change-Id: I6594cec8de6fa221fe81f663a9126b2df8762ef3
Closes-Bug: 1280454
"}]
commit_message:
Allow ``OS_DEBUG`` environment variable to specify log level.

Preserve original behavior when ``OS_DEBUG`` is ``True``, but if variable
is set to a valid log level, such as 'WARNING' use that level instead to
allow finer grained control over verbosity of log messages with the
FakeLogger.

Change-Id: I6594cec8de6fa221fe81f663a9126b2df8762ef3
Closes-Bug: 1280454

subject: Revert "timeutils: deprecate isotime()"
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-09 01:25:23.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/timeutils.py'], 'message': 'Revert "timeutils: deprecate isotime()"

This reverts commit 5cad113739fa906c3901e530fcbfdee3b48961c1.

The deprecation message says to use datetime.datetime.isoformat()
instead, but the format of the string generated by isoformat isn't
the same as the format of the string generated by isotime. The string
is used in tokens generated by keystone and other public APIs so the
format generated by isotime must continue to be used otherwise we'd
be violating the OpenStack API stability guideline. The function is
used in both keystone and keystoneclient, so if this isn't in a
common place like oslo.utils then we need to copy-paste the code
into multiple projects.

Change-Id: Iaa732bdf8597835f2422b3e984c35397e3637e01
Closes-Bug: 1461251
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "timeutils: deprecate isotime()"

This reverts commit 5cad113739fa906c3901e530fcbfdee3b48961c1.

The deprecation message says to use datetime.datetime.isoformat()
instead, but the format of the string generated by isoformat isn't
the same as the format of the string generated by isotime. The string
is used in tokens generated by keystone and other public APIs so the
format generated by isotime must continue to be used otherwise we'd
be violating the OpenStack API stability guideline. The function is
used in both keystone and keystoneclient, so if this isn't in a
common place like oslo.utils then we need to copy-paste the code
into multiple projects.

Change-Id: Iaa732bdf8597835f2422b3e984c35397e3637e01
Closes-Bug: 1461251

commit_message:
Move files into the right spot and get tests working

* Move files from keystone folder into appropriate folders
* Move tests from keystone into appropriate folders
* Fix imports to use the new module locations
* Add a _i18n.py to help with localication
* Add a BaseTestcase class
* Add a exceptions module

All just enough to run the tests. Though some tests were commented
with a FIXME to be fixed in later commits.

A few additional tests were not working with py34 and they are
skipped using testtools.skipIf statements.

Change-Id: Ib494d2a960cab5959c2adaca1eb0739fe65d14f1

commit_message:
Don't sanitize node names for log directories

The naming of nodes has recently changed so this is no longer needed. We
used to do it to strip out the random part of node names in order to
assist searching.

commit_message:
Python 3: do not use cmp(), nor sorted(..., cmp=...)

* The "cmp" function has been removed, so we must not use it any more;
* The "cmp" keyword argument of the "sorted" function has been removed, so
  replace it with "key=functool.cmp_to_key".

Change-Id: Ic39d29dc1002a68f36f04c32e53a36bc826dce78
Blueprint: neutron-python3

commit_message:
Remove usage of WritableLogger from oslo_log

With Eventlet 0.17.2, we can directly pass the logger
instance. This allows us to deprecate/remove the WritableLogger
class from oslo.log.

Closes-Bug: #1440773
Change-Id: I3985b30b499a1e676d39c2a6cd3a31ac13c0ab47

blueprint guru-meditation-report

commit_message:
Adopt oslo guru meditation report to Keystone

This spec proposes adoption for Oslo Guru Meditation reports in Keystone.
The new feature will enhance debugging capabilities of all official
Keystone services, by providing an easy way to gather runtime data about
current threads and configuration, among other things, to developers,
operators, and tech support.

blueprint guru-meditation-report

Change-Id: I40461f01039c2a1fa8e7f61f531f07bd23769d03

commit_message:
Enable Orchestration in DevStack

Heat is configured by default on DevStack for
Icehouse and Juno releases. Newer versions of
OpenStack require enabling Heat services in
DevStack local.conf.

Change-Id: I236178edab04999852d41590aeb2210a23c1a66f

subject: Wrong config file is used for the M2 plug-in
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-07 09:20:53.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-network-node.xml'], 'message': "Wrong config file is used for the M2 plug-in

The install-guide advises to edit the [ovs] section inside the
 /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini file. However, this file
 doesn't contain any [ovs] section. Instead, the install-guide
 should advise to use
 /etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini,
 which contains the section, and which should be used for
 editing the [ovs] section.

Change-Id: I7c410752b41e3f5e423bdde1f0546309f34e84a8
Closes-Bug: #1422038
"}]
commit_message:
Wrong config file is used for the M2 plug-in

The install-guide advises to edit the [ovs] section inside the
 /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini file. However, this file
 doesn't contain any [ovs] section. Instead, the install-guide
 should advise to use
 /etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini,
 which contains the section, and which should be used for
 editing the [ovs] section.

Change-Id: I7c410752b41e3f5e423bdde1f0546309f34e84a8
Closes-Bug: #1422038

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-20 11:17:40.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-initial-networks.xml'], 'message': "Missing DNS forwarder config in subnet creation

DNS will not work in the demo-instance created in Chapter 14 because
dnsmasq will not know how to handle the request in the demo-net.
ping -c openstack.org will fail without the proper forwader.

Correcting this by adding '--dns-nameservers list=true 8.8.8.8 8.8.4.4'
to the demo subnet creation.

backport: juno icehouse
Closes-Bug: #1439369

Change-Id: I9932f1c7e731a142bd097e3f35293777a397b9b3
"}]
commit_message:
Missing DNS forwarder config in subnet creation

DNS will not work in the demo-instance created in Chapter 14 because
dnsmasq will not know how to handle the request in the demo-net.
ping -c openstack.org will fail without the proper forwader.

Correcting this by adding '--dns-nameservers list=true 8.8.8.8 8.8.4.4'
to the demo subnet creation.

backport: juno icehouse
Closes-Bug: #1439369

Change-Id: I9932f1c7e731a142bd097e3f35293777a397b9b3

commit_message:
Fixes parameter order for neutron subnet-create

The order for the parameters of neturon subnet-create
is incorrect. The name of the network to which this
subnet belongs to must be placed before the CIDR.
This change fixes the placement.

Change-Id: I381e5bf66e11a6fea400737d351798033d946ae9
Closes-Bug: #1460029

subject: Uncap pytz
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-13 21:32:19.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Uncap pytz

pytz is a pretty small project without any dependencies of it's own so
it's not a transitive dependency creep risk, and Babel requires it
uncapped, so capping it in g-r is probably not a safe idea given pycadf
is using it and now has a stable/icehouse branch.

So let's uncap pytz and avoid a future gate wedge in stable/icehouse.

Change-Id: I3ca651a4377d61be3fed572355326bc180ad7eec
"}]
commit_message:
Uncap pytz

pytz is a pretty small project without any dependencies of it's own so
it's not a transitive dependency creep risk, and Babel requires it
uncapped, so capping it in g-r is probably not a safe idea given pycadf
is using it and now has a stable/icehouse branch.

So let's uncap pytz and avoid a future gate wedge in stable/icehouse.

Change-Id: I3ca651a4377d61be3fed572355326bc180ad7eec

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-06 19:54:54.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_domain_remap.py', 'etc/proxy-server.conf-sample', 'doc/manpages/proxy-server.conf.5', 'swift/common/middleware/domain_remap.py'], 'message': 'Allow default reseller prefix in domain_remap middleware

Previously, the reseller prefix needed to be provided in the host name
even when the domain was unique to that reseller. With the
default_reseller_prefix, any domain which matches in this middleware,
will will be passed on with a reseller prefix, whether or not it was

Change-Id: I5aa5ce78ad1ee2e3660cce4c3e07306f8999f02a
Implements: blueprint domainremap-reseller-domains
'}]
commit_message:
Allow default reseller prefix in domain_remap middleware

Previously, the reseller prefix needed to be provided in the host name
even when the domain was unique to that reseller. With the
default_reseller_prefix, any domain which matches in this middleware,
will will be passed on with a reseller prefix, whether or not it was
provided.

Change-Id: I5aa5ce78ad1ee2e3660cce4c3e07306f8999f02a
Implements: blueprint domainremap-reseller-domains

commit_message:
Move get_inteface_by_ip from LinuxBridge class to ip_lib

get_interface_by_ip is moved fro LinuxBridgeManager to ip_lib
as a more generic get_device_by_ip.

System-faking unit tests have been switched for functional
testing that also performs a negative test.

This can be reused in the openvswitch-agent code to validate
local_ip reusing the LinuxBridge logic.

Change-Id: I9237871a6e24dd99556c71844624be510e20d289
Related-Bug: #1464178
Related-Bug: #1408603

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-06-18 14:20:18.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/ZanataUtils.py', 'jenkins/scripts/upstream_translation_django_openstack_auth.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/upstream_translation_update.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/create-zanata-xml.py', 'jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'message': 'Support pushing translations to Zanata

In order to migrate to Zanata for translations, we need to modify
the proposal scripts to also upload translations to the Zanata
server. This commit supports most projects (those that make use of
upstream_translation_update.sh), as well as django_openstack_auth.

This does not impact the existing push and pull of
translations to Transifex, and also untouched are the translations
for Horizon or the manuals, which are all handled in separate scripts.

Co-Authored-By: stephane <stephane@alum.mit.edu>
Change-Id: I3bfb188c8b0c0e65f22d7edc30721b163f084fff
'}]
commit_message:
Support pushing translations to Zanata

In order to migrate to Zanata for translations, we need to modify
the proposal scripts to also upload translations to the Zanata
server. This commit supports most projects (those that make use of
upstream_translation_update.sh), as well as django_openstack_auth.

This does not impact the existing push and pull of
translations to Transifex, and also untouched are the translations
for Horizon or the manuals, which are all handled in separate scripts.

Co-Authored-By: stephane <stephane@alum.mit.edu>
Change-Id: I3bfb188c8b0c0e65f22d7edc30721b163f084fff

subject: support for keystone v3 api - add domains to service_identity
revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2015-06-17 21:39:55.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/endpoint.pp', 'spec/unit/parser/functions/make_keystone_role_name_spec.rb', 'manifests/resource/service_identity.pp', 'spec/defines/keystone_resource_service_identity_spec.rb', 'manifests/roles/admin.pp', 'spec/classes/keystone_endpoint_spec.rb', 'spec/defines/keystone_resource_authconfig_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/parser/functions/make_keystone_role_name.rb', 'manifests/resource/authconfig.pp'], 'message': 'support for keystone v3 api - add domains to service_identity

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:

1) Adds support for domains to service_identity.
Users of this resource may specify a different domain for both the user
and the tenant/project, or may specify the default domain which will apply
to both user and tenant.  This also adds the same domain support to
keystone::endpoint since that class uses service_identity.

2) Adds a make_keystone_role_name helper method which will construct a
valid domain aware role name.  This is intended to be used in the other
puppet modules (puppet-glance) that set notifications based on
keystone_user_role resources, in order to construct valid domain aware
names for these resources.

3) Adds a new resource keystone::resource::authconfig - this manages
keystone authentication for other puppet modules by managing the
[keystone_authtoken] section in the config.  Encapsulating the
authentication configuration in this resource will ensure that we
will be able to support the several new types of authentication coming
in current and future Keystone releases.  This supports all of the
authentication options specified at:
http://www.jamielennox.net/blog/2015/02/17/loading-authentication-plugins/

4) Cleans up domain support in admin.pp and uses the new helper method

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

Change-Id: I3d420e08c74e8a43f2431be7fd46198281438f13
'}]
commit_message:
support for keystone v3 api - add domains to service_identity

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:

1) Adds support for domains to service_identity.
Users of this resource may specify a different domain for both the user
and the tenant/project, or may specify the default domain which will apply
to both user and tenant.  This also adds the same domain support to
keystone::endpoint since that class uses service_identity.

2) Adds a make_keystone_role_name helper method which will construct a
valid domain aware role name.  This is intended to be used in the other
puppet modules (puppet-glance) that set notifications based on
keystone_user_role resources, in order to construct valid domain aware
names for these resources.

3) Adds a new resource keystone::resource::authconfig - this manages
keystone authentication for other puppet modules by managing the
[keystone_authtoken] section in the config.  Encapsulating the
authentication configuration in this resource will ensure that we
will be able to support the several new types of authentication coming
in current and future Keystone releases.  This supports all of the
authentication options specified at:
http://www.jamielennox.net/blog/2015/02/17/loading-authentication-plugins/

4) Cleans up domain support in admin.pp and uses the new helper method

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

Change-Id: I3d420e08c74e8a43f2431be7fd46198281438f13

commit_message:
Remove from BridgeDevice homemade execute in namespace

Currently BridgeDevice[1] defines homemade execute with namespace
support but could use IPWrapper. This change replaces homemade
implementation with IPWrapper use to respect DRY principle.

[1] neutron.agent.linux.bridge_lib

Change-Id: I12d4d40432e57ce8b6960276c41321c1efd98705

subject: Use just IP on get_more_nodes, too
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-17 08:30:39.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/ring/test_ring.py', 'swift/common/ring/ring.py'], 'message': "Use just IP on get_more_nodes, too

According to Sam's change[1], for now, we should change
get_more_nodes's 3rd tier to use just ip instead of ip_ports
to make cluster's failure domain to be mapped to actual hardware.
See [1] in detail.

Tiers definition here is as:
1st: Region, 2nd: Zone, 3rd: Ip (previously Ip_ports), 4th: Device

In addition, if we keep current behavior and assign different
ports to each disk in the node, get_more_nodes would do device
level search twice w/o ip level search. (at 3rd and 4th tier)
That's unfortunately wasted and not to ensure ip-level failure domain.

To fix such a situation, this patch changes get_more_nodes to use
just IP at the 3rd tier.

1: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/191970

Change-Id: I65d1b0ac904a074b235ed619d73cd0e33183b2c0
"}]
commit_message:
Use just IP on get_more_nodes, too

According to Sam's change[1], for now, we should change
get_more_nodes's 3rd tier to use just ip instead of ip_ports
to make cluster's failure domain to be mapped to actual hardware.
See [1] in detail.

Tiers definition here is as:
1st: Region, 2nd: Zone, 3rd: Ip (previously Ip_ports), 4th: Device

In addition, if we keep current behavior and assign different
ports to each disk in the node, get_more_nodes would do device
level search twice w/o ip level search. (at 3rd and 4th tier)
That's unfortunately wasted and not to ensure ip-level failure domain.

To fix such a situation, this patch changes get_more_nodes to use
just IP at the 3rd tier.

1: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/191970

Change-Id: I65d1b0ac904a074b235ed619d73cd0e33183b2c0

commit_message:
API Extensions: inherit from the ExtensionDescriptor

For consistency in the codebase, API extensions should inherit from the
abstract base class ExtensionDescriptor.

Change-Id: Id4829c265866e80c042c433bebcc01383e1e7417

commit_message:
Send mtu and vlan_transparent for network operations

We were previously removing these. But in the spirit of transparently
passing through all attributes and API calls from Neutron to ODL,
stop pruning these.

Change-Id: I741b7a4f53f6857499463a23b148dade14e41da2
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

subject: Unpin beaker-rspec
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-18 17:55:48.000000000', 'files': ['spec/acceptance/nodesets/nodepool-trusty.yml', 'Gemfile', 'spec/acceptance/nodesets/nodepool-centos7.yml'], 'message': "Unpin beaker-rspec

The latest version of beaker tries to manage sshd_config[1] in order to
pass through environment variables. JJB also tries to manage
sshd_config by adding Match blocks to securely allow root SSH[2]. When
beaker tries to append the PermitUserEnvironment line after the Match
blocks, SSH fails to open port 22 and beaker can't SSH in to the
node[3]. This patch unpins beaker-rspec and adds set_env: false to the
nodepool nodesets so that the set_env method is never called and does
not try to mess with the sshd_config.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L528
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml#n42
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/61/185161/1/check/gate-puppet-nova-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-centos7/cd81608/console.html.gz#_2015-05-22_22_05_46_933
[4] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L502

Change-Id: I9752fd76266fcaf7ad27703799967d5468317781
"}]
commit_message:
Unpin beaker-rspec

The latest version of beaker tries to manage sshd_config[1] in order to
pass through environment variables. JJB also tries to manage
sshd_config by adding Match blocks to securely allow root SSH[2]. When
beaker tries to append the PermitUserEnvironment line after the Match
blocks, SSH fails to open port 22 and beaker can't SSH in to the
node[3]. This patch unpins beaker-rspec and adds set_env: false to the
nodepool nodesets so that the set_env method is never called and does
not try to mess with the sshd_config.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L528
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml#n42
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/61/185161/1/check/gate-puppet-nova-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-centos7/cd81608/console.html.gz#_2015-05-22_22_05_46_933
[4] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L502

Change-Id: I9752fd76266fcaf7ad27703799967d5468317781

subject: Added documentation to Vagrantfile
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-16 22:21:07.000000000', 'files': ['Vagrantfile'], 'message': 'Added documentation to Vagrantfile

A couple of comments during my latest CORS review indicated that
there is a misunderstanding on why the Vagrantfile in ironic exists.
In those comments, the assumption appeared to be that vagrant is used
to provision ironic, not just the development resources necessary to
work on ironic. This patch adds documentation to clarify that.

Change-Id: I7d71adaba402a62343d1e0399ee53410b76c973f
'}]
commit_message:
Added documentation to Vagrantfile

A couple of comments during my latest CORS review indicated that
there is a misunderstanding on why the Vagrantfile in ironic exists.
In those comments, the assumption appeared to be that vagrant is used
to provision ironic, not just the development resources necessary to
work on ironic. This patch adds documentation to clarify that.

Change-Id: I7d71adaba402a62343d1e0399ee53410b76c973f

commit_message:
nova_powervm.virt.powervm.mgmt.rescan_scsi_bus

Add utility to rescan the SCSI bus, optionally with the 'remove' flag.

This is to be used when mapping instance disks to the management
partition, e.g. for the snapshot function.

Change-Id: Iea29cd2916607e1420ebb9654de3608c6534e6a5

commit_message:
Update devstack to handle Trove/Neutron setups

Default Trove configuration (for task manager and service) don't
reflect the settings required for Neutron. Trove requires a
configuration that can only be done after neutron is up. This
introduces a new function called just before starting trove services.

Change-Id: I197ec2d3975f7b551590cf1f6c7d2cb42d479e25
Closes-Bug: #1435612

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-18 04:06:27.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/prepare_node.sh'], 'message': "Remove mount of ephemeral disk

hpcloud has started sending metadata to cloud-init to mount ephemeral
disks.  This ends up writing a fstab entry for /dev/vdb.

---
$ curl http://169.254.169.254/2009-04-04/meta-data/block-device-mapping/ephemeral0
/dev/vdb
---

It's unclear why this just started happening, but it did.

devstack-gate later attempts to repartition this into swap & disk
space and mount it elsewhere.  So remove this mount from fstab -- it
shouldn't come back because the next thing we do here is tell
cloud-init to not use the metadata source.

Change-Id: I3787d0f7e5139e891686ffbb2970e65d09f112b1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove mount of ephemeral disk

hpcloud has started sending metadata to cloud-init to mount ephemeral
disks.  This ends up writing a fstab entry for /dev/vdb.

---
$ curl http://169.254.169.254/2009-04-04/meta-data/block-device-mapping/ephemeral0
/dev/vdb
---

It's unclear why this just started happening, but it did.

devstack-gate later attempts to repartition this into swap & disk
space and mount it elsewhere.  So remove this mount from fstab -- it
shouldn't come back because the next thing we do here is tell
cloud-init to not use the metadata source.

Change-Id: I3787d0f7e5139e891686ffbb2970e65d09f112b1

commit_message:
Add a mapped device to the management partition

New method nova_powervm.virt.powervm.mgmt.discover_vscsi_disk.

Based on a VSCSIMapping, scan the appropriate virtual SCSI host bus and
find the correct path of the newly-created device based on its UDID.

Change-Id: Id79b62fdd4f16f993b3563f20bc23d2d910f45a6

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-16 18:35:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py'], 'message': 'Remove duplicated debug logging around locking

Currently, iptables_manager.py does extra unnecessary logging about lock
acquisition and release. It uses lockutils.lock() which passes
do_log=True by default, which causes lockutils.lock() to do debug
logging about lock acquisition/release. IptablesManager itself also writes
debug log info about lock acquisition and release.

This change will eliminate unnecessary duplicate logging in order to
reduce log noise about locking. This change is also related to
https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/commit/f88f2fea7fe250b7d26cdcbc84633ccbbc68eeee
which reduces the logging level in the underlying lock implementation
used by oslo.concurrency. That change along with this one will remove
the duplicate debug logging about locking in iptables_manager.py and also in
ipset_manager.py.

Change-Id: If6f4a7101f3783ad83645e28bbb5c577dd403d3b
Closes-Bug: 1464727
'}]
commit_message:
Remove duplicated debug logging around locking

Currently, iptables_manager.py does extra unnecessary logging about lock
acquisition and release. It uses lockutils.lock() which passes
do_log=True by default, which causes lockutils.lock() to do debug
logging about lock acquisition/release. IptablesManager itself also writes
debug log info about lock acquisition and release.

This change will eliminate unnecessary duplicate logging in order to
reduce log noise about locking. This change is also related to
https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/commit/f88f2fea7fe250b7d26cdcbc84633ccbbc68eeee
which reduces the logging level in the underlying lock implementation
used by oslo.concurrency. That change along with this one will remove
the duplicate debug logging about locking in iptables_manager.py and also in
ipset_manager.py.

Change-Id: If6f4a7101f3783ad83645e28bbb5c577dd403d3b
Closes-Bug: 1464727

commit_message:
Enable loadbalancing of the Redis VIP, defaults to False

We have to set it to true as the default is false which means the
redis vip can't be reached. This was manifested as a problem with
ceilometer agent reaching the coordination url like [1].

Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/attachment.cgi?id=1040023
Closes-Bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1232797
Change-Id: I1cd63308d0ac1d17542e1a2a909ee1a9680ed4b3

commit_message:
Fix MD5 headers regression

This regression was introduced when we switched to
swiftclient.service.SwiftService for uploading because of a
documentation bug. The option was listed as 'headers' but it should be
'header'.

Change-Id: Id590f624aa084af0747b93ae70b214600147ebb2

commit_message:
Remove Future Parameters (write, list, delete) from ACL Validation Schema

Updated the validation schema for ACLs.
  - Removed write, list, and delete operations since they are not yet supported.
  - Added line for no additional properties other than "users" and "creator_only"
  - Added unit tests covering all of these and other conditions.
  - Updated unit tests to limit to "read" ACLs
  - Removed unit tests covering cases with more than one operation

Change-Id: Ie8a3abd22d02bb4a7bbedad373efa7435f3bdb3b
Closes-Bug: #1447872
(cherry picked from commit 1fa86f707e0b4b5923268fb34c87026d390e0eef)

the usual CI scripts can handle it.

The proper place is for all python projects

Change-Id: I12910da652c462422915bd7090cde5598754ca14
'}]
commit_message:
Setup for translation

To start translation, we need to initially import the
translation file - and place it at the proper place so that
the usual CI scripts can handle it.

The proper place is for all python projects
$PROJECT/locale/$PROJECT.pot - see setup.cfg.

Further imports will be done by the OpenStack Proposal bot.

Change-Id: I12910da652c462422915bd7090cde5598754ca14

commit_message:
Change local disk tests to use flags()

The local disk tests were directly changing the CONF variables
rather than using self.flags().  This goes against the nova
hacking rules since it can effect downstream tests cases.

Add periodic propose-requirements-constraints jobs

Once a day, generate constraints files for all participating repos
and branches, and propose updates for them when necessary.

Import only modules and update tox.ini

As stated in the OpenStack Hacking Guidelines, it is prefered
that only modules should be imported.

Also updated tox.ini to ignore opestack/common among others.

subject: Document needed pins for Puppet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-15 11:12:47.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/puppet.rst'], 'message': 'Document needed pins for Puppet

We've been running with these in CI for a while. While it's not ideal to
have to document them here as well, there's no way for someone to try
anything with Puppet because we know they will fail when not using these
pins.

If this spot isn't ideal, I'm open to other ideas about where to commit
this info  but we need to doc this stuff somewhere so we don't have to
tell people who hit issues to "go look at what tripleo-ci is using".

Change-Id: Ic76c974e162f61e117a97376a9ca54b608b51f63
'}]
commit_message:
Document needed pins for Puppet

We've been running with these in CI for a while. While it's not ideal to
have to document them here as well, there's no way for someone to try
anything with Puppet because we know they will fail when not using these
pins.

If this spot isn't ideal, I'm open to other ideas about where to commit
this info  but we need to doc this stuff somewhere so we don't have to
tell people who hit issues to "go look at what tripleo-ci is using".

Change-Id: Ic76c974e162f61e117a97376a9ca54b608b51f63

commit_message:
Move get_inteface_by_ip from LinuxBridge class to ip_lib

get_interface_by_ip is moved fro LinuxBridgeManager to ip_lib
as a more generic get_device_by_ip.

System-faking unit tests have been switched in favor of functional
testing that also performs a negative tests.

This can be reused in the openvswitch-agent code to validate
local_ip reusing the LinuxBridge logic.

Change-Id: I9237871a6e24dd99556c71844624be510e20d289
Related-Bug: #1464178
Related-Bug: #1408603

commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6116, 'name': 'li,chen', 'email': 'shchenli@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'chen-li'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7125, 'name': 'Alexander Ignatov', 'email': 'aignatov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aignatov'}, {'_account_id': 7710, 'name': 'Sergey Reshetnyak', 'email': 'sreshetniak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'sreshetniak'}, {'_account_id': 8090, 'name': 'Chad Roberts', 'email': 'croberts@redhat.com', 'username': 'croberts'}, {'_account_id': 8091, 'name': 'Trevor McKay', 'email': 'tmckay@redhat.com', 'username': 'tmckay'}, {'_account_id': 8411, 'name': 'Andrew Lazarev', 'email': 'alazarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'alazarev'}, {'_account_id': 12038, 'name': 'Vitaly Gridnev', 'email': 'gridnevvvit@gmail.com', 'username': 'vgridnev'}, {'_account_id': 13953, 'name': 'Elise Gafford', 'email': 'egafford@redhat.com', 'username': 'egafford'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-06-01 18:23:37.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/edp-edit-data-sources.rst'], 'message': '[EDP] Allow editing datasource objects

Currently there is no way to edit a datasource object. If a path needs
to be changed, for example, the datasource must be deleted and a new
one created. The most common use case is a situation where a user
creates a datasource, runs a job, and receives an error from the job
because the path does not exist. Although it is not strictly necessary,
editable datasource objects would be a convenience when a user needs to
correct a path or credentials.

blueprint edp-edit-data-sources

Change-Id: Idaef58f596b59a67f1fe953f9cd99a3a10932382
'}]
commit_message:
[EDP] Allow editing datasource objects

Currently there is no way to edit a datasource object. If a path needs
to be changed, for example, the datasource must be deleted and a new
one created. The most common use case is a situation where a user
creates a datasource, runs a job, and receives an error from the job
because the path does not exist. Although it is not strictly necessary,
editable datasource objects would be a convenience when a user needs to
correct a path or credentials.

blueprint edp-edit-data-sources

Change-Id: Idaef58f596b59a67f1fe953f9cd99a3a10932382

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-06-01 20:14:49.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/edp-edit-job-binaries.rst'], 'message': '[EDP] Allow editing job binaries

Currently there is no way to edit a job binary. If a path needs
to be changed, for example, the job binary must be deleted and a new
one created. The most common use case is a situation where a user
creates a job binary, runs a job, and receives an error from the job
because the path does not exist. Although it is not strictly necessary,
editable job binary objects would be a convenience when a user needs to
correct a path or credentials.

Change-Id: Ic376796e32e0164ada86626438e79c5d2bbf59e9
blueprint: edp-edit-job-binaries
'}]
commit_message:
[EDP] Allow editing job binaries

Currently there is no way to edit a job binary. If a path needs
to be changed, for example, the job binary must be deleted and a new
one created. The most common use case is a situation where a user
creates a job binary, runs a job, and receives an error from the job
because the path does not exist. Although it is not strictly necessary,
editable job binary objects would be a convenience when a user needs to
correct a path or credentials.

Change-Id: Ic376796e32e0164ada86626438e79c5d2bbf59e9
blueprint: edp-edit-job-binaries

commit_message:
Enable horizon integration tests voting

There was some failures in tests itself that lead to wrong 'verified'
votes for correct patches.
After depending patch would be merged (last fix), gate job would be
reliable again.

Change-Id: I4405c0ac7a6d9a5bc2505fb5d584ddbdc97b1bcb

commit_message:
Convert rebuilding ranges to instance method

_rebuild_availability_ranges has to be redefined for non pluggable
backend, so making it instance method instead of static.

In case of converting _rebuild_availability_ranges to instance method,
_generate_ip should also be converted, because
_rebuild_availability_ranges is called from _generate_ip.

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-ipam

Change-Id: Id8d8446f1014a066aa9390e560e453089ebf01bd

      for both updates and deletes.
- Serialize/deserialize input_data for RPC

Change-Id: I77b81097d2dcf01efa540237ed5ae14896ed1670

commit_message:
Convergence: Minor fixes

- adjust sync_point logic to account for deletes
      Done by having only a single stack sync point
      for both updates and deletes.
- Serialize/deserialize input_data for RPC
- Make GraphKey's the norm in convergence worker

Change-Id: I77b81097d2dcf01efa540237ed5ae14896ed1670

subject: Use just IP, not port, when determining partition placement
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 2696, 'name': 'Darrell Bishop', 'email': 'dbishop@nvidia.com', 'username': 'darrellb'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'bloodeagle40234@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-17 18:32:01.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/ring/test_utils.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_builder.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_ring.py', 'swift/common/ring/utils.py', 'swift/common/ring/ring.py'], 'message': 'Use just IP, not port, when determining partition placement

In the ring builder, we place partitions with maximum possible
dispersion across tiers, where a "tier" is region, then zone, then
IP/port,then device. Now, instead of IP/port, just use IP. The port
wasn't really getting us anything; two different object servers on two
different ports on one machine aren't separate failure
domains. However, if someone has only a few machines and is using one
object server on its own port per disk, then the ring builder would
end up with every disk in its own IP/port tier, resulting in bad (with
respect to durability) partition placement.

For example: assume 1 region, 1 zone, 4 machines, 48 total disks (12
per machine), and one object server (and hence one port) per
disk. With the old behavior, partition replicas will all go in the one
region, then the one zone, then pick one of 48 IP/port pairs, then
pick the one disk therein. This gives the same result as randomly
picking 3 disks (without replacement) to store data on; it completely
ignores machine boundaries.

With the new behavior, the replica placer will pick the one region,
then the one zone, then one of 4 IPs, then one of 12 disks
therein. This gives the optimal placement with respect to durability.

The same applies to Ring.get_more_nodes().

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Change-Id: Ibbd740c51296b7e360845b5309d276d7383a3742
'}]
commit_message:
Use just IP, not port, when determining partition placement

In the ring builder, we place partitions with maximum possible
dispersion across tiers, where a "tier" is region, then zone, then
IP/port,then device. Now, instead of IP/port, just use IP. The port
wasn't really getting us anything; two different object servers on two
different ports on one machine aren't separate failure
domains. However, if someone has only a few machines and is using one
object server on its own port per disk, then the ring builder would
end up with every disk in its own IP/port tier, resulting in bad (with
respect to durability) partition placement.

For example: assume 1 region, 1 zone, 4 machines, 48 total disks (12
per machine), and one object server (and hence one port) per
disk. With the old behavior, partition replicas will all go in the one
region, then the one zone, then pick one of 48 IP/port pairs, then
pick the one disk therein. This gives the same result as randomly
picking 3 disks (without replacement) to store data on; it completely
ignores machine boundaries.

With the new behavior, the replica placer will pick the one region,
then the one zone, then one of 4 IPs, then one of 12 disks
therein. This gives the optimal placement with respect to durability.

The same applies to Ring.get_more_nodes().

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Change-Id: Ibbd740c51296b7e360845b5309d276d7383a3742

commit_message:
Disallow backing files when uploading volumes to image

Volumes with a header referencing a backing file can leak
file data into the destination image when uploading a
volume to an image.

Halt the upload process if the volume data references a
backing file to prevent this.

Closes-Bug: #1415087
Change-Id: Iab9718794e7f7e8444015712cfa08c46848ebf78
(cherry picked from commit b1143ee45323e63b965a3710f9063e65b252c978)

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fixes Security Group Driver ICMPv6 rules

Security Group rules created with ethertype 'IPv6' and protocol 'icmp'
cannot be added by the Hyper-V Security Groups Driver, as it cannot add
rules with the protocol 'icmpv6'.

Creates stateless ICMPv6 security group rules properly.

Change-Id: Id49294965c7adb6d4fbc6c799e4ae7f30070bb71
Closes-Bug: #1466547
(cherry picked from commit 1ea0f15e6a3b050e1301274496494d732d18f0d9)

commit_message:
Enable NetApp Backends in Cinder

Enables support for configuring Cinder with a NetApp backend.
This change adds all relevant parameters for:
 - Clustered Data ONTAP (NFS, iSCSI, FC)
 - Data ONTAP 7-Mode (NFS, iSCSI, FC)
 - E-Series (iSCSI)

Change-Id: I5fea93aee61357ed22973a1bb7eef45799aa823c

commit_message:
Fix incompatiblity issue in VNX manila driver

When running Manila with VNX File OE 8.1.6 or later,
if user creates a NFS share in Manila, driver will
report nas command error when setting nfs permission.

This fix will use updated nas command to resolve it.

Change-Id: I0550cdf01278fa4e9aeed7891152fed6dcc0eefc
Closes-Bug: #1465543
(cherry picked from commit 081f9226e46ba801ba7be8024aebb967aba7f2e9)

commit_message:
Add support for WEBROOT in local_settings

Starting in Kilo, a new WEBROOT setting has been added in file
local_settings (see
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/topics/settings.html).
This requires changes in the Apache vhost configuration, too.

Change-Id: Ibbeec600502964b51c0c725c35d2afd6fd7bd9e9

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fixes Security Group Driver ICMPv6 rules

Security Group rules created with ethertype 'IPv6' and protocol 'icmp'
cannot be added by the Hyper-V Security Groups Driver, as it cannot add
rules with the protocol 'icmpv6'.

Creates stateless ICMPv6 security group rules properly.

Change-Id: Id49294965c7adb6d4fbc6c799e4ae7f30070bb71
Closes-Bug: #1466547

subject: Configurable lxc cache and rootfs path
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 7414, 'name': 'David Wilde', 'email': 'dwilde@redhat.com', 'username': 'd34dh0r53'}, {'_account_id': 9884, 'name': 'Wherenow.org CI', 'email': 'jenkins@wherenow.org', 'username': 'wherenowjenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12606, 'name': 'Miguel Grinberg', 'email': 'miguel.grinberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'miguelgrinberg'}, {'_account_id': 16687, 'name': 'Shu Shen', 'email': 'shu.shen@gmail.com', 'username': 'shushen'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-17 18:18:26.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/lxc_hosts/templates/lxc-openstack.apparmor.j2', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_hosts/tasks/lxc_cache.yml', 'playbooks/lxc-containers-destroy.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_hosts/tasks/lxc_pre_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_container_destroy/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_container_create/tasks/container_create.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_container_create/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_hosts/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_hosts/tasks/lxc_install.yml'], 'message': "Configurable lxc cache and rootfs path

The rootfs of the containers use large disk space and is defaulted to
/var/lib/lxc. It's desirable to configure an alternative rootfs directory on a
partition with large enough free space to hold the rootfs.

The rootfs of a container is hard-linked to the lxc cache when created by lxc
templates. Therefore both have to reside on the same partition and the lxc
cache shall be configurable as well as the rootfs directory.

The lxc-ubuntu template is patched by lxc-host role to use the configured lxc
cache folder. This patch should be removed once the updated upstream lxc with
support of configuring the cache path goes mainstream.

To confgiure these parameters, set the following variables in global_overrides
of openstack_user_config.yml:
    - lxc_container_directory, defaults to /var/lib/lxc
    - lxc_container_cache_path, defaults to /var/cache/lxc

Closes-Bug: #1463905
Change-Id: I9ccf0c45e0a1875644750e0d70ce613265040176
(cherry picked from commit de2dc69641d41f1a1e42dec4374f708634af55a9)
"}]
commit_message:
Configurable lxc cache and rootfs path

The rootfs of the containers use large disk space and is defaulted to
/var/lib/lxc. It's desirable to configure an alternative rootfs directory on a
partition with large enough free space to hold the rootfs.

The rootfs of a container is hard-linked to the lxc cache when created by lxc
templates. Therefore both have to reside on the same partition and the lxc
cache shall be configurable as well as the rootfs directory.

The lxc-ubuntu template is patched by lxc-host role to use the configured lxc
cache folder. This patch should be removed once the updated upstream lxc with
support of configuring the cache path goes mainstream.

To confgiure these parameters, set the following variables in global_overrides
of openstack_user_config.yml:
    - lxc_container_directory, defaults to /var/lib/lxc
    - lxc_container_cache_path, defaults to /var/cache/lxc

Closes-Bug: #1463905
Change-Id: I9ccf0c45e0a1875644750e0d70ce613265040176
(cherry picked from commit de2dc69641d41f1a1e42dec4374f708634af55a9)

commit_message:
[Manila] Add scenario for creation and deletion of Manila shares

List of changes:
- Added support of 'create' and 'delete' operations for shares.
- Added benchmark for creating and deleting shares without usage
of share networks.

Change-Id: I48adb06140f70c5d18139726f5af6d7e1ab93a47

commit_message:
Add openstack/designate-dashboard to the DNS Services project

This repository will be used for the Designate Horizon dashboard which
currently lives in designate's contrib/designate-dashboard folder. Having
it's own repo will make enabling gates, tarball releases, etc significantly
easier.

Change-Id: Iab108e88621035f04b9e21bf57ba4e9dd4c6e3f1

subject: Fix Manila jobs for running on stable/juno branch
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-18 14:23:49.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/manila.yaml'], 'message': "Fix Manila jobs for running on stable/juno branch

Manila uses 'plugin' approach in Devstack since Kilo. So, when Manila Tempest
jobs are running against 'stable/juno' branch of Manila it is just not
installed and all Tempest tests are skipped because of that. So, make jobs
distinguish two different approaches for setup of Manila using Devstack.

Change-Id: Ifb020fe8693fd4f014e944aad0c96a1e67843e4e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Manila jobs for running on stable/juno branch

Manila uses 'plugin' approach in Devstack since Kilo. So, when Manila Tempest
jobs are running against 'stable/juno' branch of Manila it is just not
installed and all Tempest tests are skipped because of that. So, make jobs
distinguish two different approaches for setup of Manila using Devstack.

Change-Id: Ifb020fe8693fd4f014e944aad0c96a1e67843e4e

Nothing is using this as of this change, but I need them in object_store
to properly create and update objects and their metadata. There's no
test update since nothing is making use of it.

commit_message:
Update the merge process for Liberty

We need to do a better job of getting visibility from the Cross
Project Liaisons. This process engages the CPLs on various
channels to ensure maximum visibility before merging a guideline.

commit_message:
Targets tests: Clean up long lines

Clean up long lines in unit tests, mostly by
using a variable for volume UUID and shortening
unnecessarily long CHAP credentials.

This is not intended to be complete, just
a good start that greatly reduces #noqa and
improves readability.

Change-Id: Iddc26a5722731d76e6d9e4b0ff493ed806bf148d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-17 10:08:35.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Increase testtools version to support unittest2

The patch increase minimal testtools version from 0.9.36 to
minimal version where testtools.TestCase is inherited from
unittest2.TestCase (instead of unittest.TestCase).
It allows to rely on single implementation of TestCase(unittest2
only) and use some features of unittest2(for example,
some projects like Sahara, Heat use self.assertRegex in test cases
but this method is supported in unittest2 only. So we need to
increase the minimal version of testtools to support this method).

Change-Id: I24d13c7701b7314e3599c94701af4b38d2dabefb
'}]
commit_message:
Increase testtools version to support unittest2

The patch increase minimal testtools version from 0.9.36 to
minimal version where testtools.TestCase is inherited from
unittest2.TestCase (instead of unittest.TestCase).
It allows to rely on single implementation of TestCase(unittest2
only) and use some features of unittest2(for example,
some projects like Sahara, Heat use self.assertRegex in test cases
but this method is supported in unittest2 only. So we need to
increase the minimal version of testtools to support this method).

Change-Id: I24d13c7701b7314e3599c94701af4b38d2dabefb

subject: Update segmented object metadata after creation
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-18 15:56:54.000000000', 'files': ['shade/__init__.py'], 'message': "Update segmented object metadata after creation

Although doing an update on a normal object after creation is
expensive, it's required on segmented object.

Change-Id: Ic82acab4f1fc8bd7cf7d75c88ee4067de3060b79
"}]
commit_message:
Update segmented object metadata after creation

Although doing an update on a normal object after creation is
expensive, it's required on segmented object.

Change-Id: Ic82acab4f1fc8bd7cf7d75c88ee4067de3060b79

With the deprecation of this method in Python2.7, the neutron hacking

neutron-vpnaas repo uses the same hacking check, the VPN test cases

commit_message:
Remove contextlib.nested from tests

With the deprecation of this method in Python2.7, the neutron hacking
check has been modified to check for this (N324). Since this check has
been upstreamed (I171fbdb89892a3d4548bf2ca52f4a7dd9ef8dccb), and the
neutron-vpnaas repo uses the same hacking check, the VPN test cases
are now failing.

This commit does the same changes as was done in neutron to remove use
of this method.

Change-Id: Ie490e89c1a65e126ad0a57d062076e472762837e
Partial-Bug: 1428424

commit_message:
Support for AMT

Addition of dependencies to support AMT nodes, as well as enabling
the driver in the ironic.conf file that is written out to disk.

Co-Authored-By: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Julia Kreger <juliaashleykreger@gmail.com>

subject: Run worldump if tempest fails
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-06-09 11:40:37.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': "Run worldump if tempest fails

If things go wrong during devstack's setup we run worlddump. Lets run
the same thing if something in tempest goes wrong, so we can collect
more data.

This will allow us to do things like trigger guru meditation reports in
nova-compute to see what it is doing (if it hangs etc.)

Change-Id: I035fe8e3333034e44b403ed0f986220ab5b0e57a
"}]
commit_message:
Run worldump if tempest fails

If things go wrong during devstack's setup we run worlddump. Lets run
the same thing if something in tempest goes wrong, so we can collect
more data.

This will allow us to do things like trigger guru meditation reports in
nova-compute to see what it is doing (if it hangs etc.)

Change-Id: I035fe8e3333034e44b403ed0f986220ab5b0e57a

commit_message:
Compute: use instance object for _deleted_old_enough method

The method _get_instances_on_driver returns instance objects so
we can use the dot notation and drop the validation that the
instance is an object.

Change-Id: Ibde61483956485d57336438b517135617b235887

commit_message:
Add ops:docs:install-guide tag

As discussed at the summit, a first simple tag to achieve would
be ops:docs:install-guide, which provides information to operators regarding
the existence and quality of install documentation for the project.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-ops-tags

To facilitate offline installs, any explicit URLs should be
moved to a location where they can be easily overridden with
a local equivalent.

That way, a default install will use the canonical location, but
a user can easily override this behavior in inventory.

(Such gymnastics are not necessary for apt/yum/pip, because those
can be configured to point to local/alternate repositories independently).

** WIP - Needs *better* documentation **

Change-Id: I9dada2fe769e30abc06dac092b9f47b99969a954
Closes-Bug: #1464787

commit_message:
Move explicit URLs in ironic-install to defaults

To facilitate offline installs, any explicit URLs should be
moved to a location where they can be easily overridden with
a local equivalent.

That way, a default install will use the canonical location, but
a user can easily override this behavior in inventory.

(Such gymnastics are not necessary for apt/yum/pip, because those
can be configured to point to local/alternate repositories independently).

** WIP - Needs *better* documentation **

Change-Id: I9dada2fe769e30abc06dac092b9f47b99969a954
Closes-Bug: #1464787

commit_message:
Update version for Liberty

Update the version for Liberty, switching from date-based versioning
to pre-versioning using SemVer. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/065211.html
and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067082.html
for details.

Change-Id: I6a35fa0dda798fad93b804d00a46af80f08d475c

commit_message:
Remove rally.deploy.__main__ hacks

These hacks make the code hard to read and create a mess of
imports, which doesn't allow us to optimize them
and reduce rally start up time.

Change-Id: I4fce652bb6c5fbdcc6e7416164baf7f2254f9c16

commit_message:
Create Magnum UI repo

The Magnum community has evaluated inclusion of this project and decided on a
governance approach for managing this project in Magnum.

Reference:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066701.html

The Technical Committee is evaluating the addition of magnum-ui to the openstack
git namespace in a Magnum governance change.

Reference: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/192804/

Change-Id: Ice2e14bf999f79ca0c0718948db616456faab907

subject: Rename ServiceNetMap: NeutronLocalIp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-10 23:52:55.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml', 'puppet/compute-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/controller-puppet.yaml'], 'message': "Rename ServiceNetMap: NeutronLocalIp

This patch renames the NeutronLocalIp option to be called
NeutronTenantNetwork. This is more consistent with
all of the other ServiceNetMap settings which end in
'Network' and initial end user feedback found the
old name a bit cryptic as well.

This is the network for neutron tenant traffic so lets
just name it that.

Change-Id: Id49afe75c372887453413c092190a5775aa3e1ee
"}]
commit_message:
Rename ServiceNetMap: NeutronLocalIp

This patch renames the NeutronLocalIp option to be called
NeutronTenantNetwork. This is more consistent with
all of the other ServiceNetMap settings which end in
'Network' and initial end user feedback found the
old name a bit cryptic as well.

This is the network for neutron tenant traffic so lets
just name it that.

Change-Id: Id49afe75c372887453413c092190a5775aa3e1ee

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-16 19:27:58.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'glance/common/wsgi.py', 'etc/glance-api.conf', 'etc/glance-registry.conf', 'glance/tests/unit/test_opts.py'], 'message': "Add client_socket_timeout parameter

Add a parameter to take advantage of the new(ish) eventlet
socket timeout behaviour. Allows closing idle client
connections after a period of time.

Leaving the sockets open may allow malefactors to attack the
system by creating many simultaneous connections, which leads
to significant cpu consumption by glance-api servers.

Setting 'client_socket_timeout = 0' means do not timeout.

DocImpact:
Added client_socket_timeout option (default=900).

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I129edb4cf6372165ce8ba3759bb40beadba9cdda
"}]
commit_message:
Add client_socket_timeout parameter

Add a parameter to take advantage of the new(ish) eventlet
socket timeout behaviour. Allows closing idle client
connections after a period of time.

Leaving the sockets open may allow malefactors to attack the
system by creating many simultaneous connections, which leads
to significant cpu consumption by glance-api servers.

Setting 'client_socket_timeout = 0' means do not timeout.

DocImpact:
Added client_socket_timeout option (default=900).

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I129edb4cf6372165ce8ba3759bb40beadba9cdda

commit_message:
fuel_upgrade: setup update/security repos

In order to deliver bugfixes and improvements to customers we have to
setup our online repos in case of successful upgrade. These repos
have to be marked with "skip_if_available" flag so yum won't fall
if there's no connectivity to them (e.g. no Internet access).

Closes-Bug: #1466418

Change-Id: I6626ff5e92c53c487f69491c09c3e0bcf022d5d4
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

commit_message:
Bump oslo.utils to >= 1.6.0

This oslo.utils release has some new utility code that can
make it possible to remove code from at least the tooz and
taskflow projects/libraries.

Mainly these new additions can allow those projects to remove
some similar code:

- exception_to_unicode() function
- raise_with_cause() function

Change-Id: Id97b5dd5a0fb30222ef5ca264882f6e0fdaf1424

subject: Return True/False for delete methods
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-17 14:18:33.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_shade.py', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Return True/False for delete methods

This changes many (not all) of our delete methods to have consistent
return values: True if the resource was deleted, False if it was not
found for deletion.

The methods being changed here either returned nothing at all, or
they raised an exception on resource not found. The ones that raised
an exception no longer raise this exception, and instead return False.

We also make sure that a debug log message is output for a delete
request that could not find the resource.

Change-Id: I0ee4654dc6f68b475179d36002fe9db713e26290
'}]
commit_message:
Return True/False for delete methods

This changes many (not all) of our delete methods to have consistent
return values: True if the resource was deleted, False if it was not
found for deletion.

The methods being changed here either returned nothing at all, or
they raised an exception on resource not found. The ones that raised
an exception no longer raise this exception, and instead return False.

We also make sure that a debug log message is output for a delete
request that could not find the resource.

Change-Id: I0ee4654dc6f68b475179d36002fe9db713e26290

commit_message:
Fix incompatiblity issue in VNX manila driver

When running Manila with VNX File OE 8.1.6 or later,
if user creates a NFS share in Manila, driver will
report nas command error when setting nfs permission.

This fix will use updated nas command to resolve it.

Change-Id: I0550cdf01278fa4e9aeed7891152fed6dcc0eefc
Closes-Bug: #1465543
(cherry picked from commit 081f9226e46ba801ba7be8024aebb967aba7f2e9)

commit_message:
Fix no attribute 'is_dvr_router' error in test_l3_agent_scheduler

cls.is_dvr_router attribute is invalid in the case which result of the
is_extension_enabled() called in resource_setup() is false.
This patch fixes it.

Closes-bug: #1465623
Change-Id: If3e9f80991b2675b4700c7cdc80b5689b444d40b

commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

Added a special test environment to keep MySQL-python support.
Documentation modified.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

Change-Id: I12b32dc097a121bd43991bc38dd4d289b65e86c1

commit_message:
Pass token and endpoint to swift os_options

get_capabilities runs through a code path in swiftclient where the auth
token pieces need to be in os_options. We also need to tell swift to use
keystone auth, not swift auth.

Change-Id: I3768f40059b6f6591f67e47a3202ed17779d0fe8

commit_message:
Add updates and security repositories

Added yum repositories for mos?.?-updates
and mos?.?-security, depending on Fuel version

After running fuelmenu, updates repo will be
verified that it can be resolved and accessible
via HTTP. If this fails, a warning is displayed
at the end of deployment and broadcast to Fuel UI.

This point was selected because Internet access
is usually not available until after fuelmenu
has been run.

Change-Id: I30e8c854147bed9901470bf1a98875180d808ab4
Partial-Bug: #1466080
Partial-Bug: #1466070

commit_message:
fuel_upgrade: setup update/security repos

In order to deliver bugfixes and improvements to customers we have to
setup our online repos in case of successful upgrade. These repos
have to be marked with "skip_if_available" flag so yum won't fall
if there's no connectivity to them (e.g. no Internet access).

Closes-Bug: #1466418

Change-Id: I6626ff5e92c53c487f69491c09c3e0bcf022d5d4
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

commit_message:
Enable Manila project in devstack hooks

All our CI Tempest jobs use 'plugin' approach of devstack that appeared
only in Kilo release. So, for the moment Manila is not even installed
and all Tempest tests are skipped because of it.

Change-Id: I45450ffdc472ad5d3f930b83b0d2288cf33975b8

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-17 22:03:37.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "puppet: make Puppet 4 unit test jobs voting

All Puppet OpenStack modules are Puppet4 compliant.
The jobs were not voting but since now all of our modules are ready, we
want to have the job voting so we keep the job stable and our code
Puppet 4 compliant.

It also makes sure it's not blocking stackforge/puppet-openstack-cloud
Puppet module, which is not part of Puppet OpenStack modules.

Change-Id: I961a64d5495b2126a25404e953c4681d40506c28
"}]
commit_message:
puppet: make Puppet 4 unit test jobs voting

All Puppet OpenStack modules are Puppet4 compliant.
The jobs were not voting but since now all of our modules are ready, we
want to have the job voting so we keep the job stable and our code
Puppet 4 compliant.

It also makes sure it's not blocking stackforge/puppet-openstack-cloud
Puppet module, which is not part of Puppet OpenStack modules.

Change-Id: I961a64d5495b2126a25404e953c4681d40506c28

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-18 08:59:17.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable migration tests for MySQL

MySQL igration tests skipped with PyMySQL because of wrong default
connection uri - `mysql//...` instead of `mysql+pymysql://`. This patch
uses OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION evn variable to set correct
connection uri for MySQL.

Change-Id: I590d2b3707548a51eaab358a5a8a780b2ceffa02
'}]
commit_message:
Enable migration tests for MySQL

MySQL igration tests skipped with PyMySQL because of wrong default
connection uri - `mysql//...` instead of `mysql+pymysql://`. This patch
uses OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION evn variable to set correct
connection uri for MySQL.

Change-Id: I590d2b3707548a51eaab358a5a8a780b2ceffa02

subject: Fix broken ACL tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-18 11:57:50.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/api/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix broken ACL tests

In keystonemiddleware 2.0.0 the token cache keys are sha256 hashes of the
token key. For versions of keystonemiddleware < 2.0.0 this is not the
case, so this patch is changing the FakeMemcache class to support both.

Change-Id: I14f6a47437ca861d3135bedbfe2b3a54de211182
Closes-Bug: #1466405
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken ACL tests

In keystonemiddleware 2.0.0 the token cache keys are sha256 hashes of the
token key. For versions of keystonemiddleware < 2.0.0 this is not the
case, so this patch is changing the FakeMemcache class to support both.

Change-Id: I14f6a47437ca861d3135bedbfe2b3a54de211182
Closes-Bug: #1466405

commit_message:
Add missing default policy rules for servers' actions

At this patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/149931 adds new rules
for servers' actions. But those rules missed in
policy.d/00-os-compute-api.json. This patch adds them back.

Change-Id: I4942574e8bad3743430d0171ff0e3cab81cbc2ab
Closes-Bug: #1435390

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-15 16:49:53.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/neutron-agent-l3', 'deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/neutron-agent-dhcp'], 'message': 'Properly kill processes in namespaces on DHCP/L3 agent stop/start

get_pid_list_for_ns_list function uses namespaces list as an argument.
Variable $ns_list is a string of namespaces divided by spaces.
To properly use all of its values we need to use all arguments ($@).

Closes-bug: #1442251

Conflicts:
	deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/neutron-agent-dhcp
	deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/neutron-agent-l3

Change-Id: I32654bf7e537247f97070ed27ab8d7b4de5b35c7
'}]
commit_message:
Properly kill processes in namespaces on DHCP/L3 agent stop/start

get_pid_list_for_ns_list function uses namespaces list as an argument.
Variable $ns_list is a string of namespaces divided by spaces.
To properly use all of its values we need to use all arguments ($@).

Closes-bug: #1442251

Conflicts:
	deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/neutron-agent-dhcp
	deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ocf/neutron-agent-l3

Change-Id: I32654bf7e537247f97070ed27ab8d7b4de5b35c7

subject: Fix DHCP conditionals
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-16 13:00:59.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/ironic-install/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix DHCP conditionals

Changed dhcp conditionals to utilize {{varname|bool}} instead
of attempting a boolean and string compare on them in case a setting
is explicitly stored as a string.

Change-Id: Iadf9d8fa1a20905afe0141acc23f9f880e6d4a84
'}]
commit_message:
Fix DHCP conditionals

Changed dhcp conditionals to utilize {{varname|bool}} instead
of attempting a boolean and string compare on them in case a setting
is explicitly stored as a string.

commit_message:
Move sahara templates to stand alone module

Move sahara templates creation to stand alone module
sahara_templates due to syncing sahara module from upstream,
which is not contain such actions.

Partial implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules

Change-Id: Ibbab5aa28c60a1dede59e5d577007d316bf44bd8

commit_message:
Move anacron module functionality to openstack::logrotate

The sole purpose of this module was replacing anacron-related files
provided by upstream packages and enabling more frequent logs rotation
schedule.

Change-Id: Ib839a3d7fcf6182e9d9d6149dd4c2ed727371c81
Implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules

commit_message:
Bind novncproxy to its own network

By default the nova vncproxy binds to 0.0.0.0, which will fail in
a loadbalanced environment.  This makes it bind to its network.

Change-Id: I08776a8f6c72b63d73433b147c130fbc9a7110b0

subject: Revert "service child process normal SIGTERM exit"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 7293, 'name': 'Elena Ezhova', 'email': 'ezhovaelena19@gmail.com', 'username': 'elena'}, {'_account_id': 9176, 'name': 'Tomoki Sekiyama', 'email': 'tomoki.sekiyama@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsekiyama'}, {'_account_id': 10115, 'name': 'Mitsuhiro Tanino', 'email': 'mittjp1129@gmail.com', 'username': 'mtanino'}, {'_account_id': 14358, 'name': 'Marian Horban', 'email': 'm.horban@gmail.com', 'username': 'mhorban'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-06-15 19:27:28.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_service/service.py', 'oslo_service/tests/test_service.py'], 'message': 'Revert "service child process normal SIGTERM exit"

After introducing commit Ie51669bd278288b768311ddf56ad31a2f28cc7ab,
child processes which are launched via ProcessLauncher are always
killed forcibly when they catch SIGTERM from parents. This breaks
existing graceful shutdown mechanism and kills child processes
even if they are ongoing.

This patch reverts the above commit and recovers functionality of
graceful shutdown again.

Change-Id: I50f57a605edf226b0c4e93234930df9c37209474
Closes-bug: 1463132
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "service child process normal SIGTERM exit"

After introducing commit Ie51669bd278288b768311ddf56ad31a2f28cc7ab,
child processes which are launched via ProcessLauncher are always
killed forcibly when they catch SIGTERM from parents. This breaks
existing graceful shutdown mechanism and kills child processes
even if they are ongoing.

This patch reverts the above commit and recovers functionality of
graceful shutdown again.

Change-Id: I50f57a605edf226b0c4e93234930df9c37209474
Closes-bug: 1463132

2) Bump stable/juno version to 2014.2.1 to fix pbr incompatibility

3) Make Tempest use stable version
- cherry-picked I5760461c1ebf8cf53ccfae55606fe6036c915e02 and used appropriate

These fixes should have been done separately, but now, this is the only way to
fix gates for stable/juno - all three at once.

Change-Id: I775ddb54cb2c75cc7f331d7ab6c98ecfcfa7b5e4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix dependencies for stable/juno branch

We have several incompatibilities for stable/juno branch that should be fixed:

1) Update of global requirements
- All updates are done using "update.py" module of requirements project:
- python update.py ../manila

2) Bump stable/juno version to 2014.2.1 to fix pbr incompatibility

3) Make Tempest use stable version
- cherry-picked I5760461c1ebf8cf53ccfae55606fe6036c915e02 and used appropriate
commit/state of Tempest, that is different than used one in cherry-pick commit.

These fixes should have been done separately, but now, this is the only way to
fix gates for stable/juno - all three at once.

Change-Id: I775ddb54cb2c75cc7f331d7ab6c98ecfcfa7b5e4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-18 12:13:59.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/fuel_agent/tests/test_nailgun.py', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/drivers/nailgun.py'], 'message': "IBP: Fixed provision fail on a node with one disk

To address some bugs about large amount of disks,
huge disks, etc. we introduced workarounds in
nailgun data driver in fuel agent.

The issue is that when only one disk on a node,
nailgun places /boot not on raid but on plain parition
and flag boot_done is set only inside 'if raid' clause,
but not inside 'if partition' clause.

Change-Id: I8a598ccde661fae375bb102f36550fb53f1abbe8
Closes-Bug: #1465971
"}]
commit_message:
IBP: Fixed provision fail on a node with one disk

To address some bugs about large amount of disks,
huge disks, etc. we introduced workarounds in
nailgun data driver in fuel agent.

The issue is that when only one disk on a node,
nailgun places /boot not on raid but on plain parition
and flag boot_done is set only inside 'if raid' clause,
but not inside 'if partition' clause.

Change-Id: I8a598ccde661fae375bb102f36550fb53f1abbe8
Closes-Bug: #1465971

commit_message:
Enable Sahara for Horizon integration tests

Sahara has been removed from global configuration, but it is needed
by some Horizon tests. As there is only one Horizon integration tests
on the gates for now, let's try to enable all tested services.

Change-Id: Ic927723d10bc45d3ec862c4f7d3152890114e39e
